characters: AN EXPLOSION OF LIGHT AND HEAT
AURA... ROCKETS UP INTO THE OAN SKY
TRYING TO CATCH IT IN HIS SLIPSTREAM AND FORCING A TURN -
EXT/INT. OTHER CITIES ALL OVER THE WORLD
GORGEOUS EXPLOSION OF ENERGY PULSES OUT
PLANE AND INTO THE SKY. HE JUST HIT THE EJECTOR SEAT
A SHOCKINGLY POWERFUL RINGBLAST STRIKES LEGION
FIRE WITH EVERYTHING HE HAS AT LEGION
THE CAR LIFT UP OFF THE GROUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s FULL. THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE stand in SHOCK and SILENCE staring up at the trademark GIANT ASTROVISION TV SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: A MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: And now, one of our own has joined them. Taking up arms against the forces of evil. Here... and everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: A weathered, GREYING MAN (60’s) whom we’1l come to know as PIPE. He’s at the end of a press conferen three seconds from changing the world:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE / PIPE, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: One of us. Now one of them. (then) A Green Lantern. SMASH TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jim says there’s gonna be thousands of people here today.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's an air show. Not the Superbowl. The blackness parts, revealing DAYLIGHT. We're in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two massive doors split, pushed by MARTIN JORDAN and his HAL (12). We’re immediately jealous of their connection.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Does it completely freak you out? All those people coming to watch you fly?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Naah. It’s not me they’re coming to see. It’s this... The FLUORESCENTS FLICKER on, revealing a fourth generatio style JET, the RAMJET. Hal races toward it.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sweet. When can I take her up?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: When you’re big enough to get in the cockpit without my help.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Mr. Ferris lets me use the simulator. I’m getting pretty killer.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Carol lets you use the sim. If her pop knew he'd kill you both. Martin lifts Hal up onto the wing.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Does it bother you that Mom doesn’t come watch you fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s not me flying planes she has a problem with. It’s me testing them.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So... why do you?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Someone’s gotta be first, Hal. The concern in Hal’s look draws Martin closer to his son. MARTIN JORDAN (CONT’D) Someday, if your brothers let you live long enough, you're gonna be an adult. And you’re gonna make a million choices. Like where to live. What kinda car to drive. Who your friends are. But every now and then, if you’re really lucky, something chooses you. When that happens, there’s no fighting it. Your mother might not agree with what I do, but she understands that much. Martin watches the concept sink in with Hal. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... Wanna checkout the cockpit? (Hal leaps up) Wait. You’re gonna need this. Martin strips off his bomber jacket, places it on Hal. Th call sign “SABRE” on the chest. As Hal gets in:

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You think Mom will understand if I’m chosen to be a Samurai?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: She’s handled worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE SOARING over open fields, CARS lined up eight rows deep. LOCALS sit on hoods and roofs. A BANNER shouts: “TH FERRIS AIR SPECTACULAR - A 5-YEAR TRADITION!!!” A DEAFENING CHEER erupts as the RAMJET BUZZES the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal (still in the bomber jacket) turns from the glass --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: That must’ve been Mach-Two! CAROL FERRIS (12), a few years and orthodontist visits aw from growing into her looks, steps beside him. She does h best to hide a blossoming crush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mach-Three. When’re you gonna learn how to read a sonic boom? (then, notices) Nice jacket. Does it come any bigger?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Nice braces. Do they come any brighter? Hal crosses to a BOTTLE of chilled DOM.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Ferris, can I crack her open? Amidst a half-DOZEN ADULTS stands an imposing CARL FERRIS (40's). He dons a rare smile. Into his headset:

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: Tower to Sabre. Your son wants to know if you’re done showing off and we can get this party started.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Roger that, Tower. Tell my son I said two fingers worth for him and that’s it.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: (to Hal You heard him, Hal. Knock it out. Hal’s about to do that when... BOOM! And not the sonic ki AN_EXPLOSION. Hal races to the window. The RAMJET SPIRALS through the air, leaving a CORKSCREW of BLACK SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Tower, I got a flameout in the starboard engine. Over.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: She can’t fly on one engine. Eject.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Can’t do it, Tower. The jet’ll go straight into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: Sabre, get outta that plane! Now!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: I’m pushing her to the runway first! Carol turns to Hal, but Hal is half-way out the room. We FOLLOW HAL DOWN THE STAIRS, bounding two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It’s too far away, Martin!

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I can do it! Sabre, I said EJECT!  5.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m clear. Ejecting now -- Sabre, I’m ordering you to eject now! An EARTH SHATTERING CRASH as Hal flies out of the buildin Carol is right after him, watching Hal frantically search PLUME of BLACK SMOKE in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Where is it? Where’s his ‘chute?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Hal...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Where’s his ‘chute?! Carol looks at him, heartbroken. GO SLOW MO as Hal, losin it, tries to run toward the crash site but an OLDER BOY (JIM), grabs hold of him. We gaze down at the DEVASTATION. Amongst the flames and metal, the SHATTERED COCKPIT tells us everything we need know. We FOLLOW the rush of SMOKE into the blue sky. HIGH and FASTER. MUSIC BUILDS. Then the pitch black of:

dialogues.speaker: IT FADES. THEN ANOTHER
dialogues.text: A SHIP SHRIEKS BY -- a small, otherworldly SPACECRAFT. INT. ABIN SUR’S SPACECRAFT A complex NAVIGATION DISPLAY. Operating it is the craft’s pilot: ABIN SUR. Noble features. Magenta skin. Abin’s RING FLICKERS and a HOLOGRAM in GREEN LIGHT appears. It’s prissy fin-headed fishman, TOMAR-RE. VIA RING:

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: You could have been there and back by now if you’d gone by ring.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: Markot deserves the proper return home. It is not often a Lantern falls. In a corner, a METALLIC COFFIN.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: What will you tell them about how he was lost?

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: All that we know. He was overpowered in the service of protecting his sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that three Lanterns were slaughtered before him --

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: There’s no cause to spread fear. A BUMP makes his ship LURCH -- the nav system GOES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: If you insist on traveling by ship, Abin, at least learn to operate one.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: We've been friends a long time, Tomar-Re. Perhaps one day I’1l understand why. The hologram shuts off. Abin’s RING PULSES. He is instant enveloped in a BRILLIANT GREEN AURA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abin, protected by that aura, FLOATS OUTSIDE his ship. He takes a moment to appreciate the view... a ballet of 63 MOONS, rotating around... SATURN. Small universe. Abin surveys his ship’s hull. He floats toward a BROKEN DISH. As he does, a FLASH BEHIND HIM -- a GOLD BLUR. Abin doesn’t see it. But we do. Abin’s Ring creates TOOLS to fix the dish (the Ring just cooler and cooler). The FLASH BEHIND HIM comes round agai This time Abin sees its GOLD LIGHT. He turns to see -- A MASSIVE CREATURE blocking out the Sun. The size of a WH with tentacles of an OCTOPUS and a SHARK’S KILLER GRIN. T is LEGION. And we fear it.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: (holy fuckshit) Great Krona -- Abin FIRES A FULL FORCE RINGBLAST AT LEGION! Everything h ring has, deployed in one massive, magnificent pulse. But nothing happens! His ring didn’t work on Legion -- wh fires forth A SERIES OF GOLD BLASTS. Abin’s ring calls up GREEN SHIELD deflecting the incoming fire. Barely. Legion’s tentacles LASH OUT, grabbing Abin and curling hi to the YELLOW FANGS of its DRIPPING MAW. Abin summons a huge GREEN HAND, grabs a passing ASTEROID sends it RAMMING -- SMASH -- INTO LEGION. Legion drops Ab buying him enough time to climb back into -- INT. ABIN SUR’S SHIP - CONTINUOUS Abin slams down the controls so that the ship’s GUNS FIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The force sends Legion flying back -- and propels Abin’s ahead... BURSTING THROUGH ONE OF SATURN’S RINGS! Legion i lost in the distance. Abin looks to a GAPING WOUND in his side. A PURPLISH STAI colors his uniform, Struggling for consciousness, Abin’s Ring generates a beam of light.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: This is Abin Sur, chosen protector of Sector 2814. I have seen what hunts us... Legion... it lives. The Ring holds no effect, no defense -- You must take action. Legion is real. (a raspy gasp, then) I have escaped... but not with my life. I shall proceed to the nearest sentient planet for selection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL what he’s aiming for: Some 820 million miles away. . Our comforting, familiar blue home. As Abin’s ship straightens to find its course we DISSOLVE TO... ANOTHER SPACESHIP? No, it just looks like a spaceship. It actually the SABRE JET, the latest brainchild of Carl Fer

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Pilots are obsolete. We're watching the Sabre as it’s put through its paces on VIDEO playing on ALL FIVE FLATSCREEN DISPLAYS in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart and modern. Models of the SABRE in various design stages. CAROL FERRIS, braces long gone and replaced with MBA, mesmerizes A FEW SUITS and TWO GENERALS.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I know conventional wisdom says planes can’t think like people. And I know conventional wisdom says U-CAVs aren’t ready for mass deployment. That the tech isn’t there yet. (beat) Conventional wisdom is for followers. Ferris Air is about to make all aerial combat missions unmanned. Today. The SUITS look intrigued -- except for one, who speaks wi the confidence of a former astronaut, current SENATOR.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: And what do you expect all those pilots we spent thirteen billion taxpayer dollars training to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If our skies are safer and their lives protected... I expect them to thank me.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: Then you don’t know pilots, Ms. Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Enough to know pilots like you are few and far between, Senator. Most aren’t four-star NASA icons. Most pilots are far more human than that. There are pilots who are cocky... Pilots who are irresponsible... CLOSE ON: A WELL-WORN BOMBER JACKET on a floor. If it loo familiar it should. It’s the one Hal’s father gave him.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And pilots who are both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN to the bed and UP the INTERTWINED LEGS of JENNA, a yo toned hottie, and... HAL JORDAN. 15 years older and not a that much more mature.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Now I remember why yoga’s my second favorite thing in life.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah? What’s the first?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Yoga instructors. It’s a photo finish with flying.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: (they kiss, then) . And what was that little maneuver called again?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: A Split-S. Also known as an Immelmann Turn. Dangerous stuff. It should only be performed by a certified professional. The sound of a CAR pulling in interrupts their good time. Then a DOORSLAM. Jenna sits up sharply. Not good.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Oh no -- he’s early.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Who's early? Jenna starts throwing clothes at Hal, a mile a minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so remember after we did those shots how I said how weird it was that Tibet was your favorite place in the world too and I broke up with my boyfriend because he wouldn’t ever go with me and you were so my type --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I may have exaggerated my enthusiasm for Far East travel --

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: That's okay. I may have exaggerated how much I broke up with my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: And he’s here? (she nods, he is) Now? Yep. Hal takes a glance out the window -- and sees her MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND walking towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re sure that’s just one guy... Hal puts his pants on both legs at once, as --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It comes down to fear...

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: All pilots are susceptible. It’s a human instinct. Train them for years, spend billions, you can’t get rid of it. And it’s fear that causes mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is out the window, pulling on his clothes, when he spots... HIS BOMBER JACKET. Still on the floor. Inside, Jenna fends off her boyfriend’s suspicions.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: I texted you all night, babe. Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: I taught a late Bikram class. The steam made my phone all sweaty. He’s about to believe the lie when he turns to find -- Ha reaching in to retrieve his bomber jacket. Busted.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Forgot this. Don’t let me interrupt you. And Hal TAKES OFF -- up the fire escape -- as --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: End of the day, pilots are only human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol leads the SUITS into the ultra-modern hangar where even more ultra modern jet rests. A SABRE PROTOTYPE.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Whereas the Sabres are more than human. Each has SAR/MTI and EO/IR sensors which feed into a sub-symbolic neural net. These aren’t drones. They’re the chess machine that can beat the grandmaster.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: Our pilots live for combat, Ms. Ferris. No machine can compete with the fire we put in our boys.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: In that case... maybe you’d be willing to suit up and fly against them in our demonstration. The Senator decides to LAUGH it off. CARL FERRIS, himself older and crankier, sidles up to Carol. Sotto:

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: Explain how pissing off the guy with the government checkbook gets us closer to congressional funding.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I can handle him Dad. You worry about getting a backup pilot. You’re still missing your third.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: He'11 show.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Really? Because I’m running out of shpiel and looking at an empty F-16.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve been preparing for this day for fifteen years, I know what I’m doing.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: There are better pilots out there than Hal Jordan. Who show up.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We don’t need better pilots. We need the ones who’1ll make the Sabre look good. Carol clocks her father’s savvy. Checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Three, two, one...  11. As they exit the hangar doors to the tarmac, on perfect c A SABRE BUZZES clean over all their heads!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen... the future of flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal FLIES across the rooftops, reminding himself:

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Next time, down the fire escape. A glance backward. JENNA’S BOYFRIEND is gaining. And homicidal. Hal whips out his cellphone as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey. It’s me. I need a favor... I’m running a little late. With that Hal LEAPS off the roof’s edge. As he’s mid-flig we MATCH CUT TO: A 1967 MUSTANG CONVERTIBLE skidding to a dead stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal gets out as his best friend TOM KALMAKU (late 20's) R UP, carrying a flight suit. Tom’s part Eskimo, all dedica nerdling. Hal snags the suit, putting it on as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: They didn’t start yet, did they?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. ‘Cause they’re waiting. For you.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Nice how everything works out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Hal round the corner toward the JETS. Carol is coming at them. Tom suddenly shifts course away.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: To the tower. She scares me.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You’re late.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: And your candy machine’s out of those peanut butter crackers. A guy skips lunch because he makes certain assumptions about snack availability.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We’re making history with the Sabre today -- not even you can ruin my mood.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Nice name by the way. Sabre. I’m sure your dad gave himself a good bonus pat on the back for that one.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It’s in your father’s honor, Hal.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: My father would’ve hated it. It’s a piece of metal, with an X-Box for a brain. It’ll never replace a pilot.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It’s beaten most of them already. He climbs up and into his jet. As he does:

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Hasn’t beaten me. How about, if I win, we go down to the riverbed and recreate a little night I like to call Junior Prom?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It wasn’t a night, more like three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Then make it dinner. You, me, lobster, your company card.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We'll see how hungry you are after you get your ass kicked. Fly safe.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Never learned how. Hal watches her go. A sight he’ll never get over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 360 degree view of the sky. ON TOM at the CONTROL STATI headset on. Carol takes her place beside him. The General and Carl arc around. Into his headset:

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you are about to engage the fearsome and mighty Sabre U-CAV. I wrote half the code on ‘em myself, so I should warn you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE F-16s LINE UP. ACROSS FROM THEM on the other si of the runway, the THREE SABRES line up opposite.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: This is gonna suck hard for you. MUSIC RISES, POUNDING LOUDER as the JET ENGINES flare... and... THE SIX PLANES take off! WE INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHTING-FAST 3-ON-3 DOGFIGHT over the California FOOTHILLS. Hal breaks formation, going after one of the Sabres. He’s more than a pilot, he’s a natural. A sharp left and Hal’s got one CROSSHAIRED.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Tower, this is Highball, I’d like to report a yawn fast approaching. Hal’s missile lock CHIMES, but the Sabre DIVES in a phenomenal, physics-shattering move. Dammit if the Sabre isn’t pursuing Hal now.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You didn’t mention they could teleport.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (to the Suits) The Sabres utilize the same targeting algorithms as your current U-CAVs, but the flying protocols are as close to human-grade as you can get... Hal's F-16 TEARS down towards the other two -- which are struggling in their own dogfight with Sabres 2 & 3. A LAS SPRAYS from Sabre 2, TARGET LOCKING right onto an F-16's tail. Sabre 2 births a MISSILE -- which EXPLODES out and

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Ion! Break right! But the missile CONNECTS, splattering the fuselage in YEL PAINT. Dead. Hal FIRES a MISSILE at the Sabre. But the Sabre BANKS -- and SOMERSAULTS -- to come around, laser target and... NAILS the third jet. SPLAT!

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you feeding those things?

dialogues.speaker: . CAROL
dialogues.text: For those keeping score, it’s now three against one. ALL THREE SABRES target Hal now. Hal pulls every move he think of -- SKIMMING THE TREES -- HUGGING the GROUND -- b nothing works. They’re flies on shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sabres are programmed to perform every flight maneuver within known parameters. The Sabres stream closer... TARGETING... he’s a split-sec from toast when HAL SUDDENLY YANKS his throttle! His F-16 CLIMBS MANIACALLY FAST. The THREE SABRES fly hard after h

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Highball, what’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: These things are programmed within known parameters... thought I’d try out the other kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom reads the screen, so does Carol. JUh oh.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He’s taking them into -- i

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: A coffin corner. Can they follow?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They don’t know not to. We never accounted for self-destructive behavior. |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the suits speaks up, sending the concern -- A suIT What's a coffin corner?

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: The altitude where a plane’s stall speed equals its Mach.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: If a plane hits it... it stalls out. Carol grabs Tom’s headset. Pissed and a little scared:

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Hal, the F-16 you’re flying is a nineteen million dollar aircraft --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: It’s insured, right?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You're not. You won’t have enough oxygen up there! You’ll pass out! WARNING LIGHTS FLASH as the unimaginable G-FORCES overtak Hal. The SABRES are still right up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I'll wake up. |  15.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Pull out! Now, dammit! Hal’s F-16 is a SPACE SHUTTLE barrelling the UPPER ATMOSPHERE. The Sabres start to SHUDDER -- but Hal has a harder time breathing. He RIPS off his MASK.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I’m losing Sabres Alpha and Beta. Make that Alpha, Beta and Gamma! The Sabres’ engines GO OUT. Another STALLS. As they all become $100 million ROCKS and PLUMMET to the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: SUIT
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: The Sabres followed Hal into a stall but because they’re unmanned, they can’t restart their own engines.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: Almost makes you wish you had a cocky pilot flying them, Ms Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (to Tom, defeated) Trigger a manual restart. The Sabres RESTART to return safely. But Hal is STILL CLIMBING. He begins to lose consciousness. A QUICK SERIES of FLASH CUTS: Young Hal watching his father’s plane tumbling from the sky... the BLAZE and HOR of the WRECKAGE itself. CLOSE ON HAL -- HE BLACKS OUT as his own engines FLICKER

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Hal just lost his engines.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Hal! Wake up Hal! But Hal is out. His plane begins to FREEFALL TO EARTH! SPINNING WILDLY -- end over end with the SUN FLASHING in eyes as we TUMBLE WITH HIM --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dammit Hal, wake up! Carol (and the rest of us) have almost lost all hope when FOOM. The F-16’s engines COME TO LIFE, blossoming with light. The plane FIRES AHEAD, PEALING RIGHT OVER THE GROU

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE JET
dialogues.text: Hal smiles, rubs his eyes like he never had a doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol beelines for Hal, as he steps off his plane.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: How stupid are you?!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Um, “Amazing moves there, Hal. You sure know your way around a Thatch Weave...” Hal spots Carl walking the Generals to their car. after them, a young man’s fury: HAL (CONT’D) If you’re gonna take jobs away from pilots, you better do it with something that can pull out of a stall!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You almost got yourself killed! And for what? To spite my father? (then) After all the times I stood up for you, the one day I needed you to come through.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I know why he wanted me here today. He thought I’d be an easy target. Sorry if I disappointed. 16. He shouts She wishes she could fire him -- but she just can’t. Ther too much history there, too much... everything.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You’re grounded. Permanently. You want to see another jet, come to the air show. Carol goes to leave. Hal calls after her, payback:

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So I'm thinking like eight tomorrow. You come by my place, we have a drink first. I’m going casual but you should wear that little blue cocktail dress -- (Carol turns) The bet. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (you’re so fucked) If you’ll excuse me, I have to go call your mother. Back on Hal, the first sign of fear in his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abin’s ship shoots into Earth’s atmosphere at destructive speeds -- a dead weight SPIRALLING -- FLARING UP with the immense heat so hot, pieces of it MELT away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO KIDS play with their TOY SPACESHIPS -- SOMEHOW they d notice THE REAL SPACESHIP STREAKING ACROSS THE SKY OVERHE

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Alien attack! Ptchoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds before the ship hits, the GREEN LIGHT surrounding focuses to the fore, as it CRASHES! DRIVING DEEP INTO THE GROUND! Dust flies... then settles. Then all goes quiet. No sign of life. The wind picks up. A THIN SNAKE OF SMOKE rises, set against the unkind sun. FOLLOW THE SMOKE DOWN TO... A FRESH CRATER IN THE EARTH. CLOSE ON: A CAPILLARY LINE of PURPLE BLOOD dripping betwe rocks. Follow the trickle to: A MAGENTA-HUED HAND. It’s ABIN’S. The wreckage crushing him. He looks to his ring.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Someone honest, someone brave... As if understanding, the RING GLIMMERS, then SPINS, becom a SPHERE OF GREEN LIGHT. Which RISES UP into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW THE SPHERE as it FLIES AROUND THE PLANET at fantas speed. A streak of light. Seeking something... or SOMEONE It crosses the DESERT... over the SUNSET STRIP and all th CRUISING DRIVERS... Picking up speed as it DOES A COMPLET CIRCUIT AROUND THE WORLD, buzzing (UNSEEN) past THOUSANDS PEOPLE... faces OLD and YOUNG... PAST SOLDIERS and FARMER and BUSINESSMEN... bypassing CONGRESS entirely... PAST A GLASSES-WEARING REPORTER at THE DAILY PLANET... OVER A COLLEGE FOOTBALL FIELD and a COACH with the name “GARDNER” on his jersey (obscuring a hero we’ll meet in t second film), the GREEN LIGHT CIRCLES him TWICE, deciding then SUDDENLY SENSES SOMETHING ELSE... As it BOLTS OFF...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. JIM JORDAN’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT It’s a summer BIRTHDAY PARTY. The Jordans are a large, gorgeous FAMILY. You won’t be able to distinguish between them at first... that’s the point. There’s a lot of them.  18. JIM (35) and JACK (25), Hal’s All-American BROTHERS are restocking the cooler. They turn to see HAL approach.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late, wasn’t the best day at |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i No kidding. A coffin corner, Hal? i (off Hal’s look) I Yeah, we heard. Carol’s voice carries. i

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Where’s Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Wondering why his favorite uncle isn’t here. He thought you forgot. Again.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I remember everything.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Like the way you remembered to pick me up for my wedding --

dialogues.speaker: HAL '
dialogues.text: I came back for you. Listen. You don’t know if Mom knows, too, do you? Hal’s mother, HELEN JORDAN (50’s) heads over. Her natural beauty almost covers the tragedy behind her eyes. Almost. The smile converts into a death glare.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: -- I’m gonna guess she does. Helen’s inches from Hal now. Quiet, stern:

dialogues.speaker: HELEN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Risking your life to prove a point. (her anguish showing) After what this family’s been through. Your father would be so disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: HAL 1
dialogues.text: Yeah, well he’s dead so... | She SMACKS him. Hal freezes, knows he deserved it. The re of the party notices. Tense, awkward silence. '

dialogues.speaker: HELEN JORDAN
dialogues.text: You only think about yourself. How did I raise such a selfish child?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You didn’t. I did this all on my own. |

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uncle Hal!  19. Hal’s nephew NATHAN (9) dives onto Hal. Breaks the tensio

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday, Flyboy. As Nathan laughs, Hal looks back to his mother. But she’s already walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk toward a SWING SET where Nathan sits. Hal pushe

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It’s okay if you didn’t get me a present.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What do you know? Maybe I did get you something. Look up there. (points to the stars) See, when I was in the Air Force --

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Before you got thrown out?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Stay with me, telling a story here... When I was still in the Air Force, I made some friends in the... Galactic Exploration Division. Top level research, secret space stuff. I asked if there were any good stars up for grabs. And you see that one right there? No one else claimed it so... it’s all yours. You even get to name it. A moment of wonder. Unfortunately, Nathan’s a smart kid.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You mean Hadar?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: It’s already got a name? A STREAK OF GREEN LIGHT whizzes past, stopping suddenly. HOVERS over HAL. Dancing around him like a bee.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: A few. Also Agena or Beta Centauri, ‘cause it’s so close to Alpha Centauri. It’s the 11th brightest star in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You know, maybe you shouldn’t read so much, get a video game or something. The BALL OF LIGHT moves THROUGH HAL’S BODY, shooting out other side and UP INTO THE SKY. Hal reacts.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Uncle Hal... you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal looks down at his chest. Unsure what just happened. D I just see something? He shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sure... Okay, Flyboy, you ready to loop this sucker? Nathan YELLS excitedly as we FOLLOW THE LIGHT farther and farther AWAY from THEM and up into the NIGHT SKY! It HITS the STRATOSPHERE and EXPLODES INTO... FOUR GLOWING GREEN SCIMITARS wielded simultaneously and expertly. We’re in the middle of a nasty fight in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HORNED ALIEN parries hopelessly against an as-yet unsee OPPONENT. The opponent works his weapons as though he wer four men, not one. Horned Alien HITS the MAT. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: HORNED ALIEN
dialogues.text: I yield. The swords VANISH into the Ring of a CRIMSON ALIEN (40s i Earth Years). Jet black eyes to match his hair. THAAL SINESTRO.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: And who said you were anything but wise? His session is interrupted when Tomar-Re enters, urgent.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: Thaal --

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Not today, Tomar. I’m too tired to fight underwater. But Tomar’s look says he’s not here for fun. SMASH INTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intense Sinestro storms down the hall. As he does he passes an ARRAY of ALIEN LIFE. All wearing versions of th same uniform. He heads toward two ENORMOUS DOORS. FIRING wild RING-BLAST that sends the great doors FLYING OPEN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the Roman Senate set against the starry heavens. Abo and looking down are --

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARDIANS
dialogues.text: BLUE SKIN and ENLARGED HEADS. TWO ROWS of them, extending into the distance. Their red and white robes billow to th ground giving them impossible stature. The Guardians communicate telepathically, projecting thei thoughts as one, directly into Sinestro’s mind.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Abin Sur is dead!

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We know --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- The Guardians mourn with you. But there is no feeling to back the words.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: When the first Lantern fell I came to this council and was told to do nothing. Will you ask that same mindless devotion of me now? Something is out there -- strong enough to kill three Lanterns, now four. We must fight back! We must arm ourselves!

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You already wield the greatest weapon the universe has ever known.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What greater arms would you carry?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: You know better than I that there is a light more powerful than this. Sinestro calls another GREEN BLAST, EXPLODING into the gr below, shattering the ancient marble. Gross insubordinati

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There was a time not so long ago that you stood before us and begged to be called Ringbearer --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- Begged for the right to defend your sector with the very weapon you now deem lacking.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: My friend dies and that’s your answer, to remind me of my obligations?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If you so wish to honor Abin Sur... train his replacement. He comes soon. Off Sinestro, sensing his defeat, and hating it... EXT. JIM JORDAN’S HOUSE - BACK ON EARTH - NIGHT Jim walks Hal out. Hal’s got extra birthday cake for late  22.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Where you headed? Please say it’s to see some girl you barely know -- please say she’s like 23 and vaguely ethnic. I love my wife but I’ve been married 10 years and I live through you.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sorry, been a long day. I just wanna be alone with my cake. Will you...

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I’'1l talk to Mom. But do anything that stupid again and you won't have to worry about her killing you. There'll be a line. Got it? A hug goodnight. Jim goes inside. Hal slides into the Mustang, starts it... only the damn thing WON’T turn over He tries again -- then it dies again. No dice.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Come on, not now. You start and I go home and today can be over -- He turns the key again -- and for a second Hal notices in rearview mirror a GLIMMER OF THAT SAME GREEN LIGHT he tho he saw before... but it’s gone just as the car STARTS! Just then, the RADIO DIAL BEGINS TO GLOW -- and guess wha color... That’s weird. Hal SMACKS the dash a couple of times. But the GLOW SPREADS, slowly ENVELOPING THE CAR... Hal pulls his hands off the steering wheel,

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...the hell is that? Coolant? In a moment the car is surrounded by a HONEYCOMB OF EMERA LIGHT. But before he can properly lose his shit -- the CA SUDDENLY JOLTS. Hal falls to the floor. He pulls himself just in time to see --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR LIFT UP OFF THE GROUND
dialogues.text: FLY! Taking out a POWER LINE as it RISES INTO THE NIGHT S

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoawhoawhoa -- Very reasonably, Hal freaks the fuck out --

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Car flying! Not cool! He sees the ground diminishing as the car ROCKETS UP! He tries steering, realizes that’s stupid, so he buckles up. Hal leans over the window and realizes he’s 2000 FEET UP! Through the GREEN SHELL surrounding the Mustang, he can s CESENA FLYING not a hundred feet off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE ANGLE: The CESNA PILOT looks in Hal’s direction - SEEING NOTHING. The car is CLOAKED. Hal’s body is suddenly bathed in the most beautiful GREEN LIGHT he’s ever seen coming from the AC vents. It calms h as WE HEAR A RESONANT VOICE coming through the RADIO: ABIN SUR’S VOICE Listen well. For you have been chosen. A FOCUSED BEAM OF LIGHT from the AC vent projects INTO HA EYES. A SHOTGUN BLAST of IMAGES and INFORMATION unfolds: ABIN SUR’S VOICE (CONT'D) Chosen by the Guardians of the Universe... A SPIRAL into the Guardians’ CITADEL. The blue-skinned ro demigods float in a ring, encircling the COSMOS. ABIN SUR’S VOICE (CONT'D) «-.as the bravest of your world. IMAGES of wildly diverse ALIEN SPECIES assault Hal’s sens ABIN SUR’S VOICE (CONT'D) Chosen to join the bravest of all worlds... The Green Lantern Corps. The CORPS. Standing like an army on the foothills of TRIN CANYON on OA. They raise their POWER RINGS in unison, a salute, emitting a blinding GREEN GLOW. ABIN SUR’S VOICE (CONT'D) Charged with maintaining peace... QUICK CUTS: All manner of GREEN LANTERNS performing acts selfless heroism. Rescuing a crippled spaceship... ABIN SUR’S VOICE (CONT'D) Across all 3600 sectors of the universe. MORE CUTS: Evacuating a planet as a supernova blooms... Battling monsters... ABIN SUR‘S VOICE (CONT'D) Without the Corps there would be only fear and chaos. PUSH IN ON the Lanterns, their grace winning the day. ABIN SUR’S VOICE (CONT'D) To serve is the highest honor. And on “honor” the EMERALD LIGHT DISAPPEARS so that Hal i looking out the windshield at the DESERT FIFTY FEET BELOW and the car PLUMMETS TOWARD IT! POOOOM! His car CRASHES into the SAND. As the dust settle we catch a familiar GREEN STREAK moving away, to...  24. CLOSE UP: Of the RING, power depleted, falling into a MAGENTA HAND. The hand closes around it. BACK ON THE TOTALLED MUSTANG. The door POPS open. A shaky and freaked out Hal FALLS OUT. He looks back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: That was so wrong! He backs away from the car like it was possessed... backi towards the jutting TAIL END of -- ABIN’S SHIP! BONK. He whacks his head on the surface -- and turns to s The strange craft illuminated by the Mustang’s highbeams. Hal stops. SOMETHING IS STIRRING inside the wreck -- Hal goes straight in. WRENCHES a metal plate off the pilot.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on, I‘ll get you outta there! One last effort and CLANG -- he throws the heavy fragment off. And then... Hal sees ABIN SUR. Sees his strange alie features. There’s no mistaking what he is. But Hal shows fear -- he tries to help Abin.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man, I don’t know what you’re supposed to look like, but you don’t look so hot. Abin Sur is beyond concern for his own life now.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: There is no moment like the first. There is so much to envy in you.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: That was you... talking to me? You brought me here? Abin’s breath is labored.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: Tell me your name.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Hal Jordan.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: Hal Jordan. I am Abin Sur. Protector of this sector. And today I must die.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Hang on, we'll get you to a hospital. (notices) That carries purple blood --

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: (points inside) In there. The Lantern. Place the Ring, speak the oath...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Hold on. Save your strength. And with that Abin finally gives his RING to Hal. The greatest gift in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: This Ring will take you... to what you cannot yet dream. Hal holds his thin alien frame as Abin draws his last bre Moved, Hal looks at the Ring this strange stranger gave h Looks to the wreckage of the ship. INSIDE THE CABIN, he sees it. An object of cold unburnish steel covered in verdigris: THE LANTERN. Hal moves towards it. Our expectation rises... when Hal’s cell phone CHIMES, “Theme from Magnum PI” RINGTONE. INT. TOM’S APARTMENT - SAME TIME - WE INTERCUT A geek paradise. Tom stands in front of a plasma, wireles controller in hand. He’s pumped:

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Man, I just got past Cortana on Halo 3. On “Legendary” difficulty. Legendary. You gotta check out the insanity on that level. You’ve never seen such crazy-ass alien mayhem. Hal glances down at Abin’s corpse.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised... Listen, I need you to come pick me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME PASSES as Hal finishes the work of burying the stran from another world. The desert sun rises in the east. A HANDFUL of DIRT thrown TAKES HIM BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grey day. Mourners gathered around Martin Jordan’s grav YOUNG HAL stares at the coffin. Carl Ferris stands at the foot of the coffin. Opposite Hal, on the other side of th grave sits YOUNG CAROL. An ocean of grief between them.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: Except for his wife and boys, there’s nothing Martin Jordan loved more than flying. Now he can fly forever. The open sky was where he was at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal’s VOICE fades in, overlapping with Carl’s -- CARL FERRIS (CONT’D) HAL’S VOICE Fly safe. Fly true. You’re Fly safe. Fly true. You’re going home at last. going home at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, reverent, is addressing the grave.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: The sky is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. Hal stands out on a road. Tom's pick-up truck pulls up. As he gets out:

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You want to tell me why we’re a million miles from nowhere when I’ve got a ton of code to comb through and I’m sorry but I didn’t pack a snack and I’m really low blood sugar cranky right now -- Then he sees it. Abin’s ship. Too real to mistake for anything. He bolts out. No words. TOM (CONT’D) HAL Hal is that a -- Yeah. Tom sees the burial mound, understands instantly.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There was something in there?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: The pilot died. Gave me this. He shows Tom the RING.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He proposed?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: He told me to keep it. Tom eyes the strange craft possessively. In love.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Did he say anything about his ship?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: We just found proof of extraterrestrial life and you want to strip the guy’s car for parts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 i

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (hitching it up) I’1l come back for your wreck tomorrow but we can’t just leave this out here. We’1ll take it to my place...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Your mom’s place?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I pay rent. It’s a quarter mine. As Tom begins to cover up the ship we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of MILITARY PERSONNEL in HAZMAT SUITS litter the terrain, probing. A BLACK SUV rolls up, a pair of shoes s out. The STRIKE of a MATCH. We follow it up to... A Briarwood pipe. REVEAL the GREYING MAN from our opening

dialogues.speaker: HAZMAT SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Sir, you really should be in Level A bunker gear, we’ve got a suit for you in the trailer --

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: HAZMAT SOLDIER
dialogues.text: This way, sir. We’ve excavated the grave, but can’t find any sign of a ship. They arrive at ABIN'S MAKESHIFT GRAVE. Pipe stares into i

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Excavate this. Leave the rest as it is. I want his body in D.C. by tonight. A look passes over Pipe’s face. Is it grief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI’s HEADQUARTERS. Nothing good happens here.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: At the frontoparietal area is a V-shaped incision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austere and impersonal. Add “scummy” and you could be talking about DR. HECTOR HAMMOND (30s), the bespectacled pathologist hovering over the CORPSE of a LATINO MAN.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (dictating) There are also five short, jab-type incisions at the lateral-most low left forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector glances at his hot lab assistant, VANESSA (20s). HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Carpe diem, Vanessa. (off her blank look) Latin. Means “seize the day.” You never saw Dead Poets Society?

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: I don’t really like old movies. |

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Great flick. Point being, one second, you're standing on a street corner, minding your own business -- or in this gentleman’s case, selling crystal meth -- when somebody comes up from behind and i stabs you repeatedly in the cingulate gyrus. Who wants to die with recriminations, things they wish they'd ' done... or people?

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: (ve: the corpse) I'd rather sleep with this guy. Hector’s boss, JOHN BROOME enters. Broome just might be a even bigger asshole than Hector.

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: Hammond. Finish up. Someone at STRATCOM wants you to perform an autopsy.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (for Vanessa’s benefit) They requested me by name?

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: I offered to send them someone good, but they insisted. They’ve got a chopper picking you up on the roof in five. EXT. TOM’S GARAGE - EVENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Hal just finished wedging in ABIN’S SHIP. Its tai stuck out the door. From 0.S. comes A LOUD VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: TOM'S MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thomas! What you doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s nothing, Ma! We’re working! |

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (suddenly five again) Hi, Mrs. Kalmaku. TOM’S MOM Hi, Harold! You want cake? I made cake.  29.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: No thanks, Mrs. K. A DOOR SLAMS, signalling her departure. HAL (CONT’D) You sure you’re gonna be okay with this?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You just gave me a lifetime supply of porn, I’m going to be okay forever. Are you gonna be okay?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sure. I’m cool. Hal gives a trademark grin and heads off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going down. HECTOR, blindfolded, stands next to an INFANTRYMAN wielding an M4 MACHINEGUN. A silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I’m not alone in here, am I? Hector hears the Infantryman cock his MACHINE GUN. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Yeah. Didn’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is seated, his blindfold removed.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What you’re about to see, Dr. Hammond, is past classified, and above top secret. Hector turns to see... PIPE approach.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not to mention, highly... unusual.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I guess you read my paper on atypical physiologic pathology. It was nominated for a Palsberg Grant... Almost.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: You're here because you’re the only pathologist I could get clearance for on such short notice. Hector goes dark as he realizes why he was picked.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: One day, I’d like to do something for the government that has nothing to do with who my father is.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: I‘1l see what I can do. Meantime, I need you to perform an autopsy. Pipe bends for a RETINAL SCAN. A CHIME and the WALL OPENS

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Underground and in secret. Who am I autopsying? Bin Laden? The president’s clone? A Martian?

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: I’m quite certain his planet of origin is not Mars, but if you can demonstrate otherwise, feel free. Pipe leads Hector into a HUGE SPACE. In the center is a GLASS CASE. Inside it: he pale magenta corpse of ABIN SUR

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: He was... a friend. And I want to know what killed him. You have three hours. As he exits, Pipe stabs a button which retracts the glass with a PNEUMATIC HISS. Hector faces the impossible corpse INT. HAL’S LOFT APARTMENT - NIGHT THE LANTERN now sits on Hal’s coffee table. Hal stares at it. FLASH CUT back to ABIN:

dialogues.speaker: ABIN SUR
dialogues.text: Place the ring, speak the oath. RESUME: HAL PUTS ON THE RING. Puts the ring into the Lantern. Music SWELLS and... um, yeah, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Subject has generalized pallor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector, in a HazMat suit of his own, dictates as he autopsies. (We tastefully ANGLE HECTOR from the CORPSE.)

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: ...which could be a tan on his planet. Moderate emphysematous changes to lungs. Correction: Lung. Subject has only one. Probably to make room in the chest cavity for his three hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HAL’S LOFT APARTMENT - THAT MOMENT Hal plus Lantern equals awkwardness. He attempts:

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I do solemnly swear to... pledge allegiance... to the Lantern. In sickness and in health.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector’s forceps wrestle with something in Abin’s ribs.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: “Ribcage” is actually a pliant cartilaginous membrane. A foreign object appears to have penetrated... Hector removes a PIECE of SHRAPNEL. It glows A FAMILIAR YELLOW. It’s hypnotic. Seductive. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) What. Are. You? We know it’s a friggin’ PIECE of LEGION. And a chunk of a ALIEN BEAST is so not good. Hector crosses to a GUARD. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) These HazMats don’t shield against radiation. You might want to get a Geiger counter in here. The guard’s gone faster than you can say “sterility.” Alo Hector returns to the body, removes his facemask. INT. HAL’S LOFT APARTMENT - RESUMING Hal, frustrated, turns away, annoyed with the Ring.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Screw this. I’m a pilot, not a Hobbit -- Hal makes his way to the kitchen for a much-needed beer. he opens the ‘fridge, he sees a STRANGE GREEN LIGHT refle in the door. Hal turns around slowly to see... GREEN WORDS. Hovering in the air, emanati lantern. Cycling through dozens of alien alphabets ne for settling on ours. Hal reads, at first barely a whisper: HAL (CONT’D) “In Brightest Day. In Blackest Night.” A LINE of GREEN ENERGY SHOOTS from the LANTERN to Hal’s r and UP HIS ARM. He reads, growing confident:

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “No Evil Shall Escape My Sight.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector’s FACE SHINES in the YELLOW LIGHT. He reaches out TOUCH the PIECE OF LEGION with his free hand.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “Let Those Who Worship Evil’s Might...” Hector touches THE PIECE and IT EXPLODES in GOLDEN LIGHT, propelling Hector across the room and onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Beware My Power...” INT. HAL’S LOFT APARTMENT - THAT MOMENT Where Hal is NOW BATHED in WONDERFUL GREEN LIGHT. A SUDDE

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: “GREEN LANTERN’S LIGHT!” Then... It’s gone. All is normal. Like nothing happened. Hal looks around in stunned silence before being STARTLED KNOCKNOCKNOCK! Hal nearly hits the ceiling. Still ina daze, he crosses to the door and opens it -- finding -- CAROL. Not in the cocktail dress but nothing to sneeze at

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Let’s get this over with. (off Hal, blank) The bet..? Dinner? Look, if you don’t want to do this --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: No. No, this is good. I don’t think I should be alone right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard kneels at Hector’s unconscious body, checking f pulse. He looks up to Pipe, who peruses Hector’s notes.

dialogues.speaker: ARMED GUARD
dialogues.text: He’s alive, sir. What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Take him home. We’re done with him. Pipe gives a last look to Abin. We sense there’s a story (and perhaps even a prequel) there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big open windows, bigger drinks. Think Gladstones on PCH. Carol’s with Hal, who seems a million miles away.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: So how do we do this? Do I give you set up lines, or do you just start gloating with the entrees?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I’m not really in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They’re at it now. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You should be. You always find a way to screw up my life, but sinking our business... unhinging a revolution in aviation... that was classic.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Maybe if your dad could build planes that didn't crash --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I’m curious, what’ Old flames, same argument. s the statute of limitations on blaming my father for everything bad that ever happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Not everything. Just one thing.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We all lost something that day. My father lost his best friend. Not to mention your brothers, or your mom. But we all moved on --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What did you lose?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You said everyone wanna know: what lost something. I did you lose? She looks at him sadly.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: What didn't I? After my dad’s breakdown, my parents split up, the company nearly folded. Which led to me not going away for school. Which led to me missing out on all the things I wanted to do with my life. I wanted to see the world, not just the town I gr (finally) Life’s full of dis still no excuse to and selfishness.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: If that’s how you bother with me --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Because... when I matter what I do, searching for his ew up in... appointment, Hal. It’s wallow in self-pity feel why do you even look at you -- no I still see that kid Dad's parachute. 33.  34. The mixture of regret and pity hanging in the air is too for either of them. They go back to their meal.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since when did lobsters become impossible to open?

dialogues.speaker: HAL CAROL
dialogues.text: I’ll get it for you. It’s okay -- She turns away to grab a waiter. CAROL (CONT’D) Waiter -- can I get a cracker, please? Hal reaches to help when FROM THE RING COMES A HUGE GREEN HAMMER which SMASHES HER LOBSTER! Splat! It tape measures back into the ring before she can see. Carol turns back:

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, you got it. Thanks. Hal stares, stunned. He looks over to an EQUALLY STUNNED LITTLE KID at the next table. Hal shoots a look -- Did yo see that too? The Kid NODS -- Uh-huh. Hal rises.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sorry, I need the... excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: OVER BY THE BAR
dialogues.text: Hal paces by an alcove. On his cell: HAL (CONT’D) If I was going insane, would I know it? INT. TOM’S GARAGE - WE INTERCUT Tom's under the ship, staring into an open panel.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Insane is the tech on this thing!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Do you hear me, the Ring Made A Giant Hammer! Either that alien’s from a planet that hates lobsters, or this Ring’s making me see things! Just then, SOMEONE BIG approaches Hal from behind.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND HAL
dialogues.text: Hang up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (not turning around) Busy here, bro.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: Not too busy to be banging my girlfriend. Bro  35. Hal turns to face Jenna’s MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND. A he’s got THREE MOTHERFUCKING HUGE FRIENDS with him.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Tom, I gotta go... get... killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HAL as he’s shoved out the door -- M.H.B. peels his jacket. Hal knows he’s outnumbered and outsized but H never backs down from a fight.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Fine. You and me. Just tell your brain trust there to back off.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: Sure. I’ma fair guy. What do you say we go punch for punch? He looks -- his buddies GRAB HAL.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What happened to punch for punch?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: I get the first ten. A SERIES OF CUTS: As Hal takes one across the jaw. BAM! I the gut. BAM! Uppercut. Cross. BAM! BAM! Hal slams down on the sand. Spitting blood from his lip. And, God bless him, staggers back to his feet. My turn. MOTHERFUCKING HUGE BOYFRIEND (CONT’D) (smiling) Okay, give it your best shot. It’s a sad sight as Hal winds up, then, something comes o him. Pure will and determination. And from that will... OUT OF THE RING comes A TEN FOOT GLOWING GREEN FIST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It FLIES AT THEM! -- PUNCHING the THREE MEN across their faces. They FLY BACK. Out cold in the sand. And just as quickly the GIANT FIST zips back into the Ring. Hal stares at the Ring. A thought passes through him and RING BLOSSOMS with LIGHT and... suddenly... The big GREEN HAND is back! Hal stares and... the GREEN H MOVES. WAVES. He’s controlling it. He thinks... it GROWS BIGGER! Hal’s eyes go wide. What else can this thing do?

dialogues.speaker: ON A NAVIGATIONAL BUOY
dialogues.text: As it bobs two and fro on the sea. A beat. Then... wham! It’s snatched in the grip of A GIANT GREEN HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a TENDRIL OF GREEN LIGHT arcs to the GREEN FIST which grips the buoy far off in the distance. Hal pulls his fis back -- the tendril going taut like a fishing line... tighter... until it SLINGSHOTS HAL out towards the ocean!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Nonononononononono! Hal decelerates. Coming in for a soft stop. A few feet above the water. Floating in a GREEN AURA.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ring making me float! Floating! He steadies himself, takes a wobbly spin left... right... Hal looks up, smiles, and RIPS INTO THE NIGHT SKY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LITTLE KID from before stares, marveling at the site GREEN HAL weaving between the tops of sailboats, masts bobbing to and fro... From him -- PAN OVER TO CAROL. Who still sits. Waiting for Hal. Story of her life. She motions to a WAITRESS, sad.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Just the check please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal SHOOTS OFF towards COAST CITY. The AURA crackling off his clothes as he soars -- a pilot flying without a jet.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Remember, it’ll fly itself if you let it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twelve year old Hal gets his first flying lesson.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Just coax it. Now pull back on the yoke. Get a little height... (then, smile) Guess what, kiddo? You’re flying.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I'm flying? (realizes, freaks) I’m flying! Whoooo... BACK IN THE PRESENT -- Hal FLIES ON. Just as thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «+-hoooooo0o! 111! Over the beach town that raised him... Down a suburban street where he extends that GIANT HAND DOWN to WHACK ALL MAILBOXES as he rips by.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to open her up. Hal aims straight up. The Ring builds velocity.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Highball to Tower. Commencing test flight. Altitude is Angels Five and climbing... The night sky roars past, breaking atmosphere as the star start to lose their focus -- BOOM. The SONIC CLOUD fans out around him. But Hal’s spee ONLY INCREASES! He realizes he’s not in charge anymore!

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still climbing! Can’t abort! Angels Eighteen!! APPROACHING extreme altitude and MACH... THREEEE!!! HAL'S POV explodes into A KALEIDOSCOPE OF COLOR AND LIGHT the UNIVERSE COMING AT HIM at speeds Einstein was sure we impossible as we... WHITE OUT. Tiny bumps FADE IN, breaking up the white. PAN DOWN, we realize it’s only the cottage cheese CEILING of: INT. HECTOR’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - MORNING Where HECTOR lies on the bed nursing the world’s worst hangover. Rubs his temples. Was it all a dream? INT. HECTOR’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS A bachelor pad on a federal salary and no taste. Hector grabs his glasses off the end table. SOMEWHERE A MAN’S VOICE (0.S.) It’s not my fault you’re an idiot. Hector looks up. Who was that? Only NO ONE’S THERE. INT. HECTOR’S APARTMENT - THE BATHROOM - MOMENTS LATER He splashes water on his face. Checks his eyes. SOMEWHERE A WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Guess I don’t have to shave, not like anyone’s gonna see it...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector looks around. Goes to put on his glasses. But they don’t fit. It’s as if the glasses have shrunk. Odd...  38. INT. HECTOR’S APARTMENT - LOBBY - MINUTES LATER Hector alights from the elevator -- he’s BENT THE GLASSES they fit. He passes his hefty DOORMAN.

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: ‘Mornin, Doc. (then) (Just keep walking, jerk.)

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Just a nice day. (then) (No Christmas bonus... Cheap bastard.) The Doorman’s lips don’t move for the insults. Hector wonders if he’s going crazy. He exits to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where he is ASSAULTED by a CACOPHONY OF VOICES. What a cocktail party in hell must sound like. (Note: From here all thoughts Hector hears will be italicized and marked V

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I wish this fat ass would I gotta hit the gym move... tonight...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Never should’ve given him my Why can’t my wife look like real number. that? Hector reels. All these INNER VOICES... it’s agony. The D BUILDS and BUILDS and we -- HARD CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector storms in, nerves run ragged from an unimaginably torturous commute. He pushes his way through the lab...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE LAB TECH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Flirt with me and I'll kick you in the nuts, I swear. I am so not in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector SLAMS the door shut. Merciful silence. QUICK CUTS, Hector rolls up his sleeve, draws blood. Examines it unde microscope, dictating into his RECORDER ~-

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Serology sample indicates some form of contamination... UNDER THE MICROSCOPE, Hector’s RED BLOOD CELLS are staine with that ethereal YELLOW GLIMMER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Erythrocytes are tinged with a yellow discoloration matching... (nickel drops) -..the color of P the fragment extracted from the deceased extraterrestrial. He reaches over for a BOX OF SLIDES. Just a few inches pa his grasp, but... it flies into his hand! Hector looks shaken. Did that just happen Hector considers, then... lets go of the box. Which FLOAT in place! Hector grins. What else can I do? CLOSE ON: A CORPSE. As -- It SITS UP! Zombie-like. REVEAL: Happy Hector. Lifting the body off the slab with his mind -- until --

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Hector. Just came in to grab the Gonzales toxicology report... The CORPSE DROPS. Thud. Vanessa turns, sees Hector. VANESSA (CONT’D) Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Wonderful, actually. Vanessa looks for the report, lost in her thoughts:

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Probably looking at porn. Again. He’s so gross. Uck, I wish he’d just die.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Careful, Vanessa... Startled, Vanessa turns to see that Hector is standing ri behind her. Flirtation gone. Replaced by MENACE. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) You might say some of that stuff out loud. By accident.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: I didn’t say anything... Hector PUSHES her against the wall with the force of his -- holds her in place. She’s terrified, but puts up a fig

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop it, Hector! Right now!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (hands in the air, “innocent”) Stop what? He advances on her, about to do... who knows what... unti  40.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on in here?! BROOME is at the door. Hector “releases” Vanessa.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Doesn’t anybody knock anymore?

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: Get away from her, Hector! Vanessa, get out of here! Vanessa hauls ass out of there, but is frozen in her trac by A VOICE INSIDE HER HEAD:

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let’s keep this our secret, Vanessa. Nobody likes a tattletale. Duly horrified, she races out. Broome lays into Hector:

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: I've laid awake nights dreaming of this moment. Ever since your father forced us to hire you, you sniveling little turd. Sexual assault. Not even Daddy can get you out of this one. You're finished. Broome turns to leave... but the door LOCKS. Broome jiggl the knob. Nothing. As he turns back:

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Actually John, I’m just getting started. Hector moves toward Broome, WIPING FRAME, as we go to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immense LONG SHOT of a resplendent AQUAMARINE PLANET. The tranquility is broken by HAL shooting out of a wormho He skids along the atmosphere like a stone across a pond, until he’s FLOATING in the stratosphere. He looks down at OA. Then up to see... SINESTRO. Hovering above him. Backlit against the Oan suns.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Welcome to Oa. And then Hal passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal STARTLES awake. Startles further when he sees he wear the green and black LANTERN UNIFORM. He’s even wearing th famous domino MASK (his pupils a gossamer white). Sinestr leans against a wall, amused.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Am I back home?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: In the grand sense, yes. First Ringflight triggers a manual return here to Oa for training.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So I’m still in... (looks around; beat) Why does outer space look like a Hyatt? Sinestro waves at a panel which makes the room WARP, to a strange ALIEN DESIGN and back again. It’s a HOLOGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: I thought a familiar aesthetic might ease your transition.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Not unless there’s a fully stocked mini- bar. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Thaal Sinestro. Protector of Sector Fourteen--

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: “Fourteen-Seventeen, home to 8012 galaxies, 40328 sentient species” -- (stops, realizing) That was not in elementary school. Why does my brain know that?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: A maiden voyage to Oa is taxing. We took advantage of your rest to accord you certain benefits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal floats naked in midair, his head bathed in a green GL Green LASERS beaming directly into Hal’s retinas.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Knowledge of all Universal Sectors, including your own, Sector 2814, has been placed in your cerebral cortex. JUMP CUT TO: Hal’s body, SPINS as thick swatches of green black and white fly on to suit his form. SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) You've noticed your uniform, which designates you as one of our number. Hal’s head. The green DOMINO MASK is CRYSTALLIZING right him, turning his eyes WHITE. SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) The mask is protocol, required to be worn by all Lanterns from planets still ignorant of life on other worlds...

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (beat) Few Lanterns wear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinestro moves towards the door, which EVAPORATES to allo his passage. Even their “doors” blow Hal (and us) away.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Come. Cadets arrive at Oa with much to learn. You even more so. Being from Gaia gives you certain disadvantages.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Gaia? You mean... Earth?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Is that what you call it now? Do you all still believe the planet is flat?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: We've got that worked out now, thanks. Sinestro’s gone. Unable to resist, Hal waves at the panel The hologram flutters in and out. Off Hal, just beginning comprehend this is actually happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A place for those who fly more than walk. GREEN LANTERNS LIMITLESS VARIETY fly and shoot and joke around. The BUILDINGS in the distance are tall as mountains. Liqu towers of living silver. The Emerald City of Oz is a dump by comparison. Sinestro notices Hal’s awe:

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: I have seen sights in this Universe to make the blindest eye water, and I can tell you... there is nothing to compare with Oa. Hal is struck silent. Tomar-Re approaches.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: Ah. Our newest recruit. He looks... warm-blooded. I am Tomar-Re, chosen protector of Sector 2813, sector nearest to your own. Hal can’t get over the site of a fish-man talking.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Pretty convenient you all speak English.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: (his top fin ruffles) I speak chkgqrvchk. The ring translates 98 percent of the universe’s known linguistic forms. Surprisingly, your English is among them.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Your ring is the most powerful weapon in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corps members train. An elegant ballet as they conjure an endless variety of WEAPONS. Like Samurai running through morning exercises. Hal watches, boyhood fantasy blown awa

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Its constructs are limited only by your imagination. Its strength limited only by your will. Hal turns to what looks like a PILE of struggling GLs.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What are they fighting?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Your instructor. Killowog. The GLs suddenly go FLYING in all directions, having been thrown off by KILLOWOG, a gargantuan rhino-creature. He lumbers over. Looks down on Hal from ten feet high --

dialogues.speaker: KILLOWOG
dialogues.text: So you're the Poozer from 2814. (sniffs) You smell funny. (leans in close, heheheh) We’re gonna have fun training you. We're not sure if Hal will ever speak again.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Ring’s power comes from the Central Battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High atop an opaline plinth stands THE CENTRAL BATTERY (f our opening). Majestic. Enormous. CRACKLING with energy.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It fuels every lantern, which in turn fuels every ring. LANTERNS fly around and up to it, charging their rings wi the formality of the righteous on pilgrimage to holy grou FIND Hal and Sinestro below, minute in comparison.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So this is what makes all that... green.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Green... the light you see, is only a manifestation of what your mind cannot comprehend.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You lost me at “manifestation.”

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: All life is connected. By love, by hope, by all the noblest instincts of the soul. This is the center of that connection. The power drawn from that connection is what you see simply as “green.” (gestures to the Battery) All that power... collected, channeled, here delivered. Entrusted to us. We can tell Hal is daunted by the grandeur of it all.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come, let us pay our respects. Sinestro motions toward a waiting LINE of LANTERNS. All manner of CREATURES assembled before a MAGENTA-SKINNED WO Abin’s widow, LIANA. Regal in her sadness. She sees them approach. Breaking ceremony she goes straight to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: LIANA
dialogues.text: You bear my husband's ring. Hal doesn’t know how to answer.

dialogues.speaker: LIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You saw him. You were with Abin Sur when he died.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LIANA
dialogues.text: A thousand years together and a thousand more taken from us. Hal can see the pain of loss. He knows it too well.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: He told me... to tell you he loved you. With his last breath. These words give her more comfort than the hundreds of we wishers. She restrains a well-spring of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: LIANA
dialogues.text: You wear the ring of a fine soldier. There are many who will miss him. Even more who owe him thanks. Do it justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hal and Sinestro re-enter, Hal studies the Battery clo now. A mixture of emotions cascading over him.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: You lied to her and think it kind. You are human.  45. Hal TOUCHES the base wall of the Battery, as he does his FLICKERS. A HOLOGRAM manifests, a rotating CORPS SYMBOL.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Um... is it supposed to do that?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: A fallen Lantern will sometimes dictate a final transmission, to reveal itself before the Central Battery -- Sinestro waits. The logo FLICKERS into the face of... LEGION! Ferociously ATTACKING ABIN! We’re re-watching Abin’s spacefight with Legion as a GIANT GREEN HOLOGRAM. ABIN SUR’S VOICE This is Abin Sur -- I have seen what hunts us -- Legion -- it lives --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinestro stands beside Hal, projecting Abin’s message for GUARDIANS to see. The horrible hologram REPLAYS on a loop ABIN SUR’S VOICE The ring holds no effect, no defense -- You must take action. Legion is real.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: “Legion is real.” The dying words of our most noble soldier. He points to the image of the snarling hellbeast.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Legion -- taking its revenge for offenses long forgotten to all but itself... And ou, the Guardians of our Universe.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What is it you desire, Thaal Sinestro?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: A Golden Light to match Legion’s. If our enemies command such power, we must too!

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is agreed action must be taken.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Gather your Lanterns. Seek the beast out and contain it.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Return with Legion defeated. And we will consider your request. Sinestro is far from sated with their answer.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We have faith in you, Thaal Sinestro. And in the Lanterns at your side. Hal takes one last look at Legion... which is currently ROARING in his face, as we HARD CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal storms out, moving somewhere, anywhere --

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: We were given leave to find Legion.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You were. I’m going home. If you’re ever near Gaia, pop over, we'll grab a drink.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: You are a member of the Corps now. You took an oath.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I recited a poem floating in my apartment! It doesn’t make that giant Spacemonster my problem.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: The Ring chose you, Hal.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: The Ring made a mistake!

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Rings do not make mistakes. Lanterns do.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: And I’d make a million of ‘em. Trust me. (then, re: his Ring) Look, I had a good life before this showed up. Before rhino instructors and purple widows, who quite frankly made me feel really guilty. This whole alien army deal... it’s not my thing.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Legion was in your sector, Hal. In your home system. If any trace of that demon fell to your planet along with Abin... it will ravage your homeworld like a cancer. A look crosses Hal’s face. Is it worry? He catches himsel

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: See, the Ring did make a mistake. Because another guy -- he would care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal’‘s on a PLATFORM. Tomar-Re and Sinestro instruct him.

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
