dialogues.text: Leaving? Well, the Ring adheres to your will. “Simply will yourself home.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Where do I FedEx it when I’m done?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: The Ring has selected you. It is yours until you fall in battle. Or elsewhere. (a little grim) We await your return, Hal Jordan. Hal gives a nervous look -- then LIGHTING UP IN HIS GREEN

dialogues.speaker: AURA... ROCKETS UP INTO THE OAN SKY
dialogues.text: SINESTRO (CONT’D) (turns to go) Gather our brethren, Tomar, strengthen their hearts. Battle awaits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A desolate stretch of West Virginia farmland. A CABIN nex to a run-down BARN. A grey sky hangs overhead.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: “Transcendental abilities testing. Day 2, Hour 16.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector paces the barn surrounded by hay and empty stalls. documents into a DIGITAL RECORDER, a scientist’s dispassi

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: “Telekinetic manipulation shows no elemental limitation, including all objects, both material... A bright red APPLE floats out of a BUSHEL full of them. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) “,..and organic. Weight or size don’t appear to be factors.” He looks up to see Broome dangling in mid-air above him. apple floats onto a tattered and cut Broome’s head.

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: Please let me go, Hector! We can forget this whole thing ever happened -- !!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Working here, John. Science is our only refuge in the face of the incredible... Hector lifts a pair of SHARP GARDEN SHEARS with his mind.

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: Don’t kill me, please!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Kill you? We're bestest buddies, John. We just made one of the most profound discoveries in the history of pathology. And he PITCHES the shears -- they FLY -- Broome squints a THUNK! It lands in the apple! Phew. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) “Rim seems to be getting better.” Hector thinks, Broome’s arm moves. A human marionette. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) “With minimal concentration, I can Maintain complete gross motor control. Hector dictates as Broome RISES HIGHER to the rafters --

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “It's a bit like animating a puppet. A big dumb puppet you’ve wanted to throttle every day for years.” Broome tries to plead for his life. But all of a sudden finds he can’t speak. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) “Although I can control the subject’s jaw and tongue, efforts at creating speech have proven...”

dialogues.speaker: BROOME HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Grorl. “,..Disappointing. ” Broome GURGLES his fears. Hector’s CELL PHONE RINGS. Enou to snap his concentration... Broome PLUMMETS to the groun HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) (into phone) Hello? I can’t today. Tell him I’m in the country... Fine. I’11 come in. Hector snaps the phone off. He looks over to see... Broom Floating an inch above the ground. Unharmed. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) We’re going to have to cut this short. It seems I have to pay my father a visit. Good work today, Buddy. As he lets Broome drop the final inch, SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Architecture that exudes the dependability our leaders do

dialogues.speaker: AIDE, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Sign here, Senator. INT. SENATOR’S OFFICE - DAY Capacious, complete with an “ego wall.” We recognize the behind the battleship-sized desk as the SENATOR from our opening Sabre demo. An AIDE waits as the Senator finishes signing some docume Hector waits nearby, less patient.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Senator. The Aide takes documents and exits --

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Sorry to make you wait.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: No problem, Dad. Not like I’ve got anything better to do. And we realize this is SENATOR HAMMOND. Hector’s father. produces a TICKET clipped to a FLIER.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Here. Ferris fields in Coast City. They invited me to fly -- a slab of butter to get me to sign off on a huge appropriations request. But any chance to show I’ve still got some moves.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (off the flier) An air show? I didn’t know they still had these.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (getting to it) So. Your lab called. You haven’t shown up for work in days.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Just taking some personal time. Trust me, my boss knows all about it. Hector concentrates, reading his father’s thoughts:

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Another job you’ll be fired from. Hector tries to hide his pain -- the pain of confirming w he’s always suspected his father thought about him. SENATOR HAMMOND (V.O.) (CONT’D) All of life’s opportunities, and you’re such a disappointment. (the final knife) How is it possible you’re my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector turns away, trying to hide his torment. Spits out

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Air show and truancy. Did we cover everything?

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Since you’re on vacation, maybe you can make it tomorrow? The Senator claps Hector on the shoulder, demonstrating t limit of his affection.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t miss it, Dad. You know how I love to watch you fly.

dialogues.speaker: EARTH
dialogues.text: A KH-10 SATELLITE floats into view. WE HEAR A WARP SPEED WHOOSH accompanied by a GREEN FLASH as -- HAL COMES OUT of warp speed, inelegantly SKIDDING to a st like it’s his first day on a snowboard. He looks down to the vomit-inducing view of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (to the Ring) Good... space-flying, Ring. But home is a little further -- And Hal bullets to Farth. The Satellite toddles in his wa HAL (CONT’D) -- dooocowwwwwwwwnnnnnn...

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Where is he? It’s two in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Carol lays into Tom --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: That’s late even by Hal standards. Behind Carol, HAL DESCENDS in full uniform. She misses it but Tom gets a full on holy shit view of Hal’s landing.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Um, I think he just pulled up. Carol turns to follow Tom’s gaze... but Hal’s uniform recrystalizes back into his regular clothes.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Hey, Carol. Sorry about last night. I kinda had to... take off --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Save it. I’m sure wherever you had to go was more interesting. Carol storms out. Hal shakes his head. Tom is slackjawed.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You did not just fly here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide variety of VINTAGE AIRCRAFT are lined up. Delta Wings, F-16Cs, Warbirds, etc. Carol marches past them, he still full of steam, as Hal races to catch up --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Carol... How can you walk so fast in heels? Carol, I’d explain but --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It’s not hard to figure out. We had our first serious conversation in years and your 12 year-old brain couldn’t take it so you bolted. By this point, they've arrived at a trio of F-16C FIGHTIN FALCONS. Three PILOTS descend, one from each cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What're the Three Douches doing here?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: The air show’s tomorrow. They’re making sure the Senator’s F-16 is flight-ready.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You're letting that geezer in a Falcon?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Well, that wasn’t exactly Plan A, but it turns out one of my pilots screwed the pooch on the flight demo. Meaning Hal. Who looks over the line of aircraft, eager.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So which one of these bad boys is mine?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Well, let’s see... Not this one. Or this one. Not this one either... That’s the thing about being grounded, you stay on the ground. Gas ‘em up. She walks off. The Douches CRACK UP. Hal shakes his head, can’t win... then spots a way for his day to get worse:

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: his beloved MUSTANG hangs from a tow truck. A corpse. Hal walks to it. Tom approaches. He flips Hal the Mustang KEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You’re welcome by the way -- nine hour drive to Arizona, no big deal. No reason to reward that kinda loyalty by maybe telling me what the hell happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I went to their home planet. The less said about the whole thing the better. Hal deposits the Ring in the beat-up GLOVE COMPARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (as Hal walks off) That’s fine. Keep it to yourself. I’m sure there’s absolutely nothing cool about aliens in outer space. SMASH TO: THOUSANDS of LANTERNS. Some big, some small, so furry -- but you wouldn’t want to fuck with any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous COLISEUM under a star-flecked sky. The meetin hall of the Corps. Sinestro stands before THOUSANDS, his ring conjures IMAGES of FOUR LANTERNS overhead.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fellow Lanterns. Today we mourn the loss of our finest. Four of our brethren struck down by a single terror: Legion. The four images converge into ONE larger IMAGE OF LEGION. SINESTRO (CONT’D) Do not deny the truth of your own eyes. Legion is no myth. This image comes from the ring of Abin Sur himself. Proof of the unthinkable: The Lost Sector has been breached. Legion roams free. And it has a taste for your death. Alone we cannot defeat it. But we are not one Lantern. (a warrior'’s cry) We! Are! THE CORPS! CHEERS erupt. Sinestro ring conjures his trademark scimit Other Lanterns also conjure their own individual weaponry

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Together... our light shines with the will of all that lives. Together we will search every star in every sector of the Universe until our enemy is within our grasp! And together --

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANET OA
dialogues.text: More CHEERS as LANTERNS shoot off the planet and in the direction of their 3600 sectors. Lighting up the night sk

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: -- We Will Be Victorious! As SINESTRO himself shoots TOWARD CAMERA. KRAK-KOOM! A SONIC BOOM quakes. WIPING US TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stadium-like BLEACHERS have replaced the homespun cars-in field arena from fifteen years ago. But the crowd is no l enthusiastic as a quartet of WARBIRDS PERFORM. ON NATHAN, somehow bobbing head and shoulders ABOVE the t crowd. He glances down, as if talking to someone below --

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you flying today, Uncle Hal? REVEAL Nathan is perched on Uncle Hal’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Inner ear infection. They WALK PAST the huge STAGE in front of the bleachers. audience erupts with APPLAUSE as SENATOR HAMMOND strides the stairs and into one of the F-16C Falcons we saw earli

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (OVER SPEAKERS)
dialogues.text: -- three-time winner of the Flying Cross and record-holder for most spacewalks, Senator Robert Hammond! As he returns the applause with a conquering hero’s wave

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fly safe, Dad. The Senator turns around. Who said that? He looks, only there's no one there... But a hundred yards away...

dialogues.speaker: BY A CONCESSION STAND
dialogues.text: HECTOR WATCHES. A piece of popcorn floats neatly into his mouth. He smiles, taking his place in the stands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the SENATOR'S JET at the center and head of an elaborate formation. The man can fly. Carol, Carl, and Tom at the controls. Hal (miffed) and Na (transfixed) watch from the window. Carl keys his headset

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: How's it feel to be back in the saddle, Senator?

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Like riding a bike. With 40,000 pounds of thrust strapped to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: You boys ready for the Chandelle?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger tower. Preparing Chandelle.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: A Chandelle? You’d think a guy who’s looped the space shuttle could fly without training wheels. Carol shoots Hal a daggers-stare. Back into her headset:

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: At least he’s flying. And setting up for a knife-edge pass.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Butter knife.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (quietly, to Hal) If you treated her nicer, maybe she’d let you fly.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You just summed up women in general, little man.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE FALCONS
dialogues.text: split out of their three-man formation. Hal shakes his he disapproving. Back to Nathan: HAL (CONT’D) See that? They should’a been at ninety degrees before coming out of formation.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: HECTOR furrows his brow. A grin spreads as he concentrate

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SENATOR'S FALCON
dialogues.text: the plane RATTLES slightly. The Senator grips the joystic with two hands. It resists him... just a little...

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE FALCONS
dialogues.text: barrel roll around and speed towards each other. Hal sees something in the move that troubles him. HAL (CONT’D) Carol --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Yes, Hal, I know. You could’ve done it better.  55.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, but look -- Falcon Three’s shimmying a bit.

dialogues.speaker: THE SENATOR
dialogues.text: is fighting his controls now. They’ve jammed on him.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR
dialogues.text: grins, enjoying this. The first time in his life he’s controlled his father.

dialogues.speaker: THE SENATOR'S FALCON
dialogues.text: SHUDDERS as it rockets towards the other two jets.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: turns from the window, to Carol, as the three jets angle their wings, ready to pass each other dangerously close.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (urgent) The move’s not coming off right. Get ‘em to throttle down. Before Carol can respond --

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: Something’s wrong, tower. Controls aren’t responding. You seeing this? They do now, as THE SENATOR’S FALCON CLIPS the wings of t other two jets, sending them SPINNING out of control!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Mayday! Mayday! Holy hell! Hal’s heart stops. He doesn’t hear the pilots but instead

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tower, I got a flameout in the starboard engine! Over! Nathan looks to his Uncle. But just like that fateful day Hal has already bolted -- out the door. MARTIN JORDAN (V.O.) (CONT’D) I’m pushing her to the runway. I can do it! I can do it!  56. STAY WITH HAL as he POWERS DOWN THE STAIRS, taking them t at a time, just like he did at twelve. In fact -- With each footfall, we alternate FLASHCUTS TO Young Hal bounding down those same stairs, until he EXPLODES out to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal SMASHES through the door, feet pounding straight past HECTOR -- who smiles, as -- THE THREE FALCONS corkscrew through the sky. Falcon 1 blazing DIRECTLY TOWARDS --

dialogues.speaker: THE BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: Terror from the CROWD as the wayward jet MISSILES AT THEM BACK WITH HAL -- his childhood trauma being relived. Only this time he’s no helpless kid. He's a rocket on foot, POUNDING to his busted Mustang. He reaches for the glove compartment -- only the fucking thing is jammed shut!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: C’moni!! C’mon!!! C’mon!!!

dialogues.speaker: FALCON 1
dialogues.text: grows EVER LARGER in frame, casting a SHADOW over the CRO BACK WITH HAL -- as HE RIPS the compartment open! STAY ON HIS FACE to see it BATHED in that BRILLIANT GREEN LIGHT.. It’s time.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: With the terrified audience as Falcon 1 grows even closer on top of us now, fiery death seconds away -- when --

dialogues.speaker: THE JET FREEZES MID-FLIGHT
dialogues.text: Wrapped in a GREEN FORCE FIELD. Close enough to their hea to touch. One of them does. Poke. Stunned silence as they look up, past the levitated jet to see him... World, meet THE GREE! f People go BALLISTIC! CHEERING WITH a welcome worthy of th

dialogues.speaker: LEGENDARY HERO HAL JUST BECAME
dialogues.text: HECTOR goes slack-jawed at the incredible sight... The wo just got a lot more interesting. He stares as -- HAL’S RING -- sets Falcon 1 down on the tarmac. The CROWD on its feet now, applauding. But it ain’t over yet, as --

dialogues.speaker: FALCON 2
dialogues.text: SPIRALS its way overhead. A GREEN BOLT OF LIGHT FLARES fr where the Green Lantern just stood, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i i i i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i  57. INSIDE THE COCKPIT, the SENATOR SCREAMS. Unable to eject. THE GREEN BOLT OF LIGHT races the runaway jet -- blinding fast, outpacing it -- until the green blast MORPHS into - A HUGE NET. WHICH CATCHES THE FALCON! It pulls taut, straining. THE SHOT RUNS THE LENGTH OF THE NET to its source: THE GREEN LANTERN, pulling with all his strength. It nearly yanks his shoulders from their sockets. BACK WITH HECTOR -- Concentrating on his father’s Falcon, fighting against Green Lantern’s amazing strength -- and losing. PAIN surges through Hector’s body ~- as he “pushe harder with his power -- but -- Green Lantern has the Falcon secure. The strain becomes t much for Hector -- and the buildup of his power is RELEAS FIRING OUT in a WAVE -- which blindsides Falcon 3. The je is suddenly PROPELLED with the full force of Hector’s min The PILOT EJECTS -- but --FALCON 3 CRASHES INTO THE BASE

dialogues.speaker: THE CONTROL TOWER
dialogues.text: A massive EXPLOSION of jet fuel! A scream of tortured met as THE TOWER LURCHES FORWARD! Defeated, Hector ducks into the crowd, instinctively grab his head in pain to quell the mounting pain, as --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TOWER
dialogues.text: The room PITCHES FORWARD. Nathan FLIES towards the observation window -- now perpendicular to the ground -- SMASH! The window FRACTURES... spider-webbing under his weight... but doesn’t break!

dialogues.speaker: ON FALCON 2
dialogues.text: as it skids gently onto the tarmac. THE GREEN NET tape measures back into GL’s Ring. But there’s no time to celebrate as he BLAZES towards the tower.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TOWER
dialogues.text: Nathan keeps low, precarious, like crawling on thin ice.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Stay there, Nathan! No thought to her own safety, Carol climbs onto the glass get him! CRACKS spindle even further. She reaches out and... HEAVES Nathan up, OVER TO SAFETY -- but... The momentum CATAPULTS her forward... further on to the sloooowly shattering window... and -- THROUGH IT! CAROL FALLS to the fiery ground below! Seconds become milliseconds. Death’s arms opening wide, until -- GREEN LANTERN catches her! Holding her close as he ZIPS h away from the rushing ground.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (pitching his voice) Easy, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Am I dead?

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (um, something a “hero” would say) Not on my watch. She clutches GL even tighter. Which he doesn’t mind one b

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We're flying --

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: It gets better. And in one fluid motion, GL whips around, ring blazing to project a GIANT HAND that PUSHES the leaning tower uprigh A SECOND BLAST fuses the metal at the base. The tower stabilizes. ON CAROL -- who can’t believe it all. For the first time Hal's life, someone looks at him like a hero. It feels go So does the ROAR from the euphoric crowd below as the GRE LANTERN flies off with Carol on his arm over their heads into the night sky. Brilliant green against midnight blue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! Hector stumbles to the sinks. His hands pressed to his THROBBING forehead in electric pain. A gale-force migraine burrowing into his brain. He reaches to splash water on his face, but can’t make it SLUMPING to the floor. Something is happening to him... h head... He howls in pain as his glasses SNAP OFF HIS FACE It's too much -- he PASSES OUT. As we PUSH IN on Hector, vein in his head PULSING sickeningly, CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GL flies into view. Carol in his arms. They glide towards the coast. He lands softly on the sand beside her.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Who... are you?

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Sorry. No names on the first flight. Maybe next time. The emerald aura does a slow creep up his uniform. The Gr Lantern slowly floats upward. Carol calls after him:  59.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Next time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he disappears into the sky. A green rocket. And savior

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Then I’11 see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire truck sirens illuminate the night and paramedics hel shell-shocked patrons. Everyone too worked up to notice t WHISP of GREEN LIGHT zipping down behind a hangar. A beat later, Hal walks out, casual. Carl wheels around towards him, a little accusatory...

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: Where were you, Jordan?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sorry. I had to get out of there. It was a little too... familiar, y'know? Tom comes over, Nathan in tow, buzzing with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Uncle-Hal-oh-my-god-did-you-see-it-was-so cool-there-was-a-flying-guy-who-came- in-- whoosh--with-this-kickass-green-suit-and-- ptchoo-ptchoo--shot-laser-beams-out-of his-fist --

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Hal; sotto) Dude, seriously, I’m running out of ways to be jealous of you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: And phshoo---he-saved-everyone-even-the pilot-and-flew-off--shoom!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (to Nathan) Calm down, Flyboy. Catch your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hal walks Nathan home...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Do you think he’s an alien or mutant or both? Or maybe he’s a regular guy who got his powers from a nuclear accident! As Nathan brushes his teeth. Hal watches... NATHAN (CONT’D) Wait then there'd be radiation from all his laser beams and everybody he saved’'d grow like extra arms or a third eye!  60. As Hal puts Nathan to bed...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe he gets his powers from his suit so anybody who wears it’d be able to fly around! What do you think, Uncle Hal?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (spitballing) Maybe he’s one of 3600 space police who work for blue-skinned aliens and patrol the universe using their power rings. Nathan looks at Hal like that’s the dumbest idea in histo

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're right, must be nuclear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal walks downstairs to find his mother, watching the new

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Jim and Nancy aren’t back yet?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Stuck in traffic. There’s still a lot of media at the air field and the looky-loos are clogging up the highway. ON THE TV: Grainy footage of Green Lantern flying over th crowd as captured by someone’s CELL PHONE CAMERA. HELEN JORDAN (CONT’D) It has to be a stunt. Like how they made the Statue of Liberty disappear.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Gotta be.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN JORDAN
dialogues.text: (but...) What if it’s not? What if -- what if he’s some kind of, what did Nathan call it? Super-person?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Super-hero, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN JORDAN
dialogues.text: Could you imagine? If it’s all real. That someone like that is real. As they watch the footage of Hal as GL, Helen wishes alou

dialogues.speaker: HELEN JORDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It would’ve been nice if there had been someone like that around fifteen years ago, wouldn't it? We PUSH IN on Hal. The thought lands hard on him. i

dialogues.speaker: BROADCASTER
dialogues.text: Another tragedy today... INT. HAL’S LOFT APARTMENT - NIGHT Hal lies in his couch, TV remote in hand. Channel surfing Trying to let the growing thought pass without action.

dialogues.speaker: BROADCASTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ...Shots exchanged over the tense border killing 18 guardsman and wounding... The channels JUMP THROUGH from one news network to the ne each one paining Hal more -- each one making him feel mor deeply the need to do something.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS BROADCASTERS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Eight Gotham teenagers arrested after filming the beating of another teen... (jump to) «--Coast Guard at St. Roch say a father and son are presumed drowned after their fishing boat capsized... (jump to) ...Fighting continues in Corto Maltese, where missiles... Each change of the channel brings more death, destruction

dialogues.speaker: A LAST BROADCASTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: At least 48 people have been killed and 176 wounded since Sunday... Until he can take no more. Hal GRABS what he needs to mak it all better. The Lantern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reminiscent of our opening because it’s exactly the same hangar. Now completely empty. Hal walks inside, the Lante dangling from his fist. The Ramjet dissolves into translucent view. And Martin Jordan. And a young Hal. Ghosts from the past...

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN
dialogues.text: -.-every now and then, if you’re really lucky, something chooses you. When that happens, there’s no fighting it. The memory fades -- and with it the doubt behind Hal’s ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SENATOR plays on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I spent my entire career being called a hero and thinking I deserved it. I’ve never been so humbled as I am today, seeing what a real hero looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen suddenly FRACTURES. As we watch the TV being smashed apart, to bits, then to dust, as if by a ghost of some powerful petulant child (or a more powerful Hector)

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Of course. Someone’s got to be more than human to finally impress you. Well, he’s not the only one... REVEAL HECTOR. The proportions of HIS HEAD different than before. Bigger. Ever so slightly monstrous. He’s changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector enters to find Broome bound to a nearby post.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Good news, John, you’ve been promoted. From lab rat to accomplice. Broome looks at his captor with renewed horror. As he’s RIPPED away from his post...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HATCH OPENS, daylight reveals a subterranean space.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Fallout shelter. Right below Runway 2 actually. Was all full of canned food and bottled water... I ate the beef jerky and chucked the rest. Hal and Tom descend the staircase to find... ABIN’S SHIP. Tom’s made certain... modifications. Like an aeronautical collage. Tom shows it off: TOM (CONT’D) The combustion chamber was totally shot. The jet vanes were torqued. Don’t even get me started on what thruster control looked like...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So you turned it into... Frankenship?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I tried to find replacement parts, but the Apple Store was all out. (then, quieter) So. You really want to do this? (beat) This Ring chose me for a reason. Maybe if I do some good I’11 figure out what that reason is. Tom smiles. A little proud. Maybe more than a little. i

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: So what do we do first?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: First, we charge.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Charge?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (holding up the lantern) “In Brightest Day..." On Tom, the BLAZE OF GREEN reflecting off his face and ma him cover his eyes. Our MUSIC SWELLS, and... HIGH IN THE SKY, the rising SUN flaring behind him, the G LANTERN rockets towards camera, a new focus in his eyes..

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (overlapping) -- reports are starting to come out of San Francisco -- starting to come out of Boston --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAN in a high speed police chase. GL lands on the roof. GIANT GREEN HANDS reach inside, start tossing out bad guy

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- Fawcett City -- Star City --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CRIMINALS from the freeway chase, smushed together in GREEN NET. GL takes off before the COPS can offer thanks.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- reports of a flying man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinestro WHIPS PAST frame. Followed by an ARMY of Lantern

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- some kind of hero, people are saying -- The phalanx of Lanterns move in unison into a DIVE, plummeting towards... Legion. The battle is joined!

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- saying they’ve never seen anything like this before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A towering INFERNO. Smoke billows out from fifty-story windows. GL swoops in, Ring blazing.  64.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- wild speculation about who he is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broome enters, moving towards the teller window with fitf jagged steps as if under some external control. And he is

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- some concern that he shouldn’t be trusted -- Broome passes SECURITY CAMERAS as they SHATTER in success Up to the window, where the TELLER smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: It’s not me. It’s him. He’s controlling me. Broome passes A NOTE. She reads it: “THIS IS A ROBBERY. D WHAT THE VOICE SAYS.” She puts the note down. Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: BANK TELLER
dialogues.text: Who is? What voice, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This one. Off the Teller, eyes wide with realization and terror...

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- authorities are worried that if he turned to crime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE GREEN CHUTES spring from GL’s Ring, coiling around other like DNA as people slide to safety.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- there’s no telling what he could do. A gesture and a HUGE GREEN TUBE sucks the blaze out of th building, cycloning it harmlessly into mid-air.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Your attention please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUMP CUT AROUND the bank, HEARING HECTOR’S TELEPATHIC VOI ECHO HELLISHLY, like a P.A. system underwater --

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is a bank robbery. GUNS fly from the holsters of the Bank’s two SECURITY GUA instantly KNEECAPPING them both. Instant PANIC.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Please stop screaming. I’m trying to concentrate here. Only one customer holds calm, casually filling out a depo slip, smiling. Of course, it’s HECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On the floor. Everyone. ONE OF THE GUNS spins in the air, covering the bank patro The other ZIPS straight over to Broome at the teller wind

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: (pleading, impotent) Please. Empty the safe.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: -- the kind of power never before seen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The International Space Station. One of its modules has broken off. It tumbles towards camera, dragging an ASTRON by his tether. As the astronaut and module spin into infinity... GL rockets out of the atmosphere. To the resc

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: -- like some fantasy -- A GREEN BEAM secures the wayward module, reeling it back towards the station, but... the beam starts to FLICKER. Then... cuts out as the Ring PULSES THREE TIMES. NEWS BROADCASTS (V.O.) (CONT’D) -- some are speculating if there’s any limit to his power --

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (to Astronaut) One second, okay? I’1l be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green Lantern swoops inside to find Tom. Holds up his Rin

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Running low on gas. Tom holds up the Lantern in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GL, fully recharged, returns -- much to the Astronaut’s relief. GREEN TENDRILS sprout from the ring, reining in t Astronaut and the loose Module.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- right now, it seems infinite -- GL shoots off, STAY WITH the curtain of stars and CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinestro and the Corps in a pitched battle against Legion And they are losing. Lanterns fall right and left, those already dead tumble silently in the weightlessness of spa

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- it seems as if no one or no thing could ever defeat him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol is watching a TV broadcast of GL, edge of her seat.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- across the globe -- all around the world, people are standing in silent amazement -- el sorprender -- stupéfier --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green Lantern lowers two cargo holds’ worth of FOOD CRATE onto the sprawling desert using a MASSIVE GREEN FORKLIFT.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- terrified -- estarrecido -- INT. CAROL’S OFFICE - DAY Carol watches Green Lantern’s Darfur heroism on the TV, CHEERING like a sports fan.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- amazing -- amazed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green flash streaks overhead, racing twilight.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS BROADCASTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- and life on our little planet will never be the same...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GL glides down and over. It’s dark, save for a single lig shining from one lone window. GL smiles. Who else? INT. CAROL’S OFFICE - SAME TIME Carol works late. A KNOCK interrupts her. Only it’s not t door. Carol pulls the shades to REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Right outside her window. Odd when you consider her offic is five stories up. He waves with the Giant Hand. Carol waves back. The Giant Hand points UP. To...  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol steps out to the roof. Where Green Lantern hovers, aura enclosed, a few feet above the roof.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: I hope it’s okay. Coming back here. When there isn’t a disaster. Carol lights up like Christmas. It is.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I’m glad. I wanted to see you, I didn’t know how. You don’t have a signal to shoot in the sky? Maybe a phone number? GL just smiles. He’s trying hard not to say too much, or give anything away.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, I guess guys who float all the time don’t have cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: I walk too. His feet touch the ground. The aura around him fades.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: So you’re still... a person? But how to you do... all that? She mimes -- Giant Hand. GL raises his ring hand.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: This. It can make anything. (off her wonder) Anything I can imagine. GL demonstrates. Suddenly, hanging in the air in front of her, is a beautiful light-statue of CAROL. Spinning slowl in place. Lovely. How he sees her. Carol takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Lucky I look good in green. (then) That must be nice. Anything you can imagine and it comes to life... Anywhere you want to go and you can fly there.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: You’ve got a hangar full of planes with your name on them. You can fly.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Not like you. I have... responsibilities here. I can’t just go jetting off to Venice for the first time right now.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: So you’ve never been?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Me? Nope. For a girl who flies a lot I’ve never been anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Tokyo? (shakes her head “no”) Paris? Carol goes quiet. Sad.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I always thought, you should never see Paris alone... And I counted on the wrong people to take me. Regret on GL’s face. Another failure as Hal. One more thi he can repair as the Lantern. He holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: C'mon... He leads her to the roof’s limit. Right up to the scary ledge. Long way down. GREEN LANTERN (CONT’D) It’s okay. Take my hand. (she steps forward) Close your eyes. Trust me. Carol does. Then is lit with GREEN LIGHT as GL uses his r to lift her UP... then unexpectedly DOWN... to ground lev GREEN LANTERN (CONT’D) Now... open. She does. Opening her eyes to see --

dialogues.speaker: PARIS
dialogues.text: OF LIGHTS, WROUGHT IN GREEN LIGHT. He’s made it all for h The Champs-Elysees... Notre Dame... the roiling Seine... Eiffel Tower towering over it all! The Giant Hand gently LIFTS Carol... and sets her down at the glowing “Arc de Triomphe.” She has a perfect vista vi of the sprawling unreal. CUT TO: A POLICE SKETCH of the lead suspect in the Federation Ban robbery, looking a lot like Broome, resting on the desk i INT. UNDISCLOSED FACILITY - PIPE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Pipe picks up an FBI PERSONNEL FILE. A file photo of Broo Compares it to the sketch. Yup, same guy. Not good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipe enters. We hear a THUMP. And we see --  69. A LARGE GLASS DOME. Another THUMP from inside. Something rattling around inside the DOME. PAN DOWN to REVEAL it’s filled with: SMALL CAGES. Each cage housing a WHITE LAB MOUSE. THUMP -- A CAGE FLIES UP. THUMP -- a piece of CHEESE FLIN OUT. THE MICE ARE MAKING THINGS LEVITATE! Just like Hecto Pipe looks to a SEALED CONTAINER INSIDE, FILLED WITH YELL LIGHT -- glowing with Legion’s bilious hue. We understand now: They've been experimenting. Pipe picks up a phone --

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Find Senator Hammond. PAN OVER the mice to find a sedentary one. It’s not hard see why it doesn’t move: Its forehead is grotesquely HUGE Without moving, the mouse CRUSHES its steel bowl into a B

dialogues.speaker: PIPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell him we have a situation. Off this glimpse of Hector’s future... FLASHES OF WHITE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP! SNAP! FLASHBULBS pop like fireworks as VIPs, FOPs, and plus-ones stride a RED CARPET in black ties and ball gowns. A fabulous Washingtonian event. A SLICK PORSCHE TEARS UP FRONT AND CENTER. Hector alights Looking like the million bucks he stole. A SMOKING HOT DA on his arm. The best money can (and did) buy. THE ROW OF PHOTOGRAPHERS are suddenly compelled by his po to stop what they’re doing, turn, and come over to take h picture. Their arms and legs moving for them. Hector poses, making his grand entrance. People are, as h hoped, impressed. The eat-your-heart-out moment he craved Crossing the red carpet he overhears the CROWD’S reaction

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who is that? / Is that Hammond’s son? / I thought he worked for the Bureau. / I thought he was in jail. Hector stops by a STUFFY CONGRESSMAN and his WIFE, friend

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Congressman! Hey, I haven’t seen you since you fired me from that internship. Why was it again? Right! ‘Cuz I got your lunch order wrong. This is Dawn. (off his date; hearing a thought) Ah, I believe you two’ve already met. You hired her before too, right?  70. Loud enough for the wife to hear. He claps the mortified Congressman on the shoulder and moves on into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, glass walled, two-story open space. All manner of historic aeronautic and space vehicles hang from the ceil The floor’s been cleared to make way for a HUGE MODEL of INTERNATIONAL SPACE STATION (ISS). SIGNS and BANNERS info us this shindig is to celebrate its completion. But all attention turns when the DOORS FLING OPEN of thei own accord and... Hector makes his entrance. He struts hi stuff like a man without limits.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Senator Hammond, glad-handing with A SENATOR, sees his so the center of attention. The desired effect. Hector spots his father, approaches, snatching a drink as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Hector. What a... surprise. You're looking a little puffy. Are you okay? He’s reacting to the odd bulge at Hector’s temples.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Never better. Lately I’ve been interested in space exploration. I was thinking of making a major donation...

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good thinking. It’s a fine cause. (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my credit card, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I can afford it. I recently came into a fair amount of bank.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: That’s great, Son. I’m glad to hear it. (v.0.) What am I going to do with you? Not what Hector was hoping for. He tries, weakly --

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Isn’t this what-- You always told me you wanted me to be more successful.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I told you I wanted you to find some direction. (thinks ) Now you’re just a well dressed disappointment. Trying to blunt the pain, Hector knocks back his drink.  71.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Nothing’s ever gonna be enough, will it?

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I've got a speech to give. Think about making it an early night, okay? (thinks ) Go home before you embarrass us both. A knife-pierce of paternal disappointment. He claps Hecto on the shoulder. That familiar paternal gesture, insincer

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: as he approaches the Dais. Until he’s buttonholed by Pipe who grips his arm. Urgent.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Senator Hammond. I need to talk to you about your son. We have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Story of my life. Talk to him yourself. He’s here somewhere. News to Pipe, whose eyes instantly memorize the terrain. Senator breaks free of Pipe, heading up towards the stage Pipe speaks into his cuff --

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Set a perimeter. Subject’s inside. As a STEALTHY TEAM OF PIPE’S MEN hone in on the exits --

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: climbs the dais, commands the microphone. The crowd instantly silences. He looks to the ISS, speaks genuinely

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Few things unite all people. For me, it’s the way we all look at the stars. For answers. For inspiration. For hope. No matter who I talk to, anywhere in the world, we all share that. And now the stars have started giving us answers. Who knows what else we'll find up there, so long as we’re brave enough to look -- Suddenly, the Senator lifts from the podium! Floating, fr of gravity, up and over the heads of the GUESTS.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just out of curiosity, when exactly did you decide I was such a disappointment? The question drives painfully into his mind.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Hector?!

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You think it’s easy having a living legend for a father? The giant windows EXPLODE OUT. Wind rushes in. PEOPLE SCREAM. The Senator struggles.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Hector, if you’re doing this somehow --

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Would that finally be enough to impress you? Would it, Dad?! SIRENS and ALARMS WAIL as a mob rushes the exits. But one man surges upstream: Hector. Marching towards his father. HECTOR HAMMOND (V.O.) (CONT’D) What if I told you I could read your mind? That I could hear your shame! or that I could rip you in half with a single thought!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector stands in front of him now. Out loud: HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Maybe now I’m the one who’s disappointed in you!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND HECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Put him down, Hector. Hector turns to see he’s surrounded by Pipe and his MEN. DOZEN GUNS trained on him. He turns to Pipe, recognizing

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: You. You did this to me. You exposed me. Changed me... Into this.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: We didn’t know-- We had no idea there would be this kind of infection --

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: It was an alien corpse! What could possibly go wrong? 12 Berettas CHAMBER in unison as Pipe tries to hold his m back, reasoning with Hector, voice soothing --

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: Hector, we don’t want anyone to get hurt--

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Then I’d suggest you put away your guns. Pipe’s eyes go wide with realization. Starts to bark an order -- STOP! -- but too late: The guns FIRE! -- only... the bullets all WHIP UPWARDS! --  73. Riddling Senator Hammond! CRIMSON blossoms on his chest, eating up the white of his shirt. He drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (dry) | You guys killed my Dad. And in one insane fury -- FOOM! -- Hector launches the GU up and out and through the atrium glass walls! Hector advances on Pipe.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So there are these headaches I’ve been meaning to ask you about -- Hector’s about to tear into Pipe -- but is stopped by --

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (a wheeze) Hector -- Hector turns to discover his father is still alive. For n SENATOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) I'm... sorry...

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: You... may’ve read my mind... But you couldn't read my heart. I always loved... And he’s gone. Off Hector, trembling with grief and rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits in front of his TELEVISION ARRAY. All tuned to t news as usual. As Tom cracks open a fresh sleeve of Pringles, one of the screens comes alive with “BREAKING N about the Air & Space Museum. Pringled Tom doesn't notice

dialogues.speaker: CAROL, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Do you know what’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking through the “Paris” lights, wandering its amazing streets, GL and Carol remain blissfully unaware of world events. Carol marvels at the level of beauty and detail.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what you’ve done for the world.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Me? I haven’t done that much. Carol stops, looking straight at him. Meaning it.  74.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We stopped believing something amazing was still possible. I’m not talking about the flying or Paris. I mean... what you are. Normal people... they disappoint.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Not everyone.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Most. You’re someone they can count on. When there’s nothing else left. Now everyone knows... there’s a hero.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Maybe the world just hasn’t been paying attention. Maybe there’ve been heroes all along, right in front of you, but you didn’t know it... Maybe he-- they... didn’t even know it. Carol stops. Facing him.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: All I know is who’s here for me now.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: You know you’re standing very close. I could light up at any second.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I know. His GREEN AURA LIGHTS UP AROUND THEM BOTH, drawing them together -- lips atoms apart -- the fire of anticipation about to meet with the jet fuel of imminence -- until --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Hello! The aura stands down. GL leans over Carol’s shoulder to f -- Tom. Running up to them, full bore.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Hey. Uh, Mr. Lantern?

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (“I’m deciding how to kill you”) Anything I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sorry! It’s just-- There’s something going down at the Smithsonian! GL looks to Carol -- Sorry. Carol understands --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Go.  75. With a BLUR OF GREEN -- he’s gone. Paris fades around her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerie stillness. Broken only by SOBS and helicopters circ overhead. The choppers shine spotlights below, illuminati HECTOR, cradling his father, HOWLING, grief struck.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE
dialogues.text: It’s alright, Hector. It’s gonna be alright. Just come with me. Hector sees Pipe. A moment of childlike submission. Then the grief darkens, instantly transmuting into RAGE. Hector glares. Pipe drops to the floor, stricken with PAI

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: That’s what it feels like in here. Like someone scraping the inside of your skull, right? Forks in your eyes. And it keeps getting worse. That’s my whole life now. Thanks to you. Pipe is writhing. Hector stands over him, ready to kill. Pipe is in agony, death fast approaching -- when --

dialogues.speaker: A GREEN ROPE
dialogues.text: entwines around Pipe’s ankle -- YANKING him to safety. Similar GREEN LINES snake around anyone still in harm’s w pulling them all OUT, to safety. Hector turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: drop from the sky. GL lands in front of the fallen Senato His ring quickly wraps Hector in GIANT MANACLES.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: No one else needs to die today.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Oh, I can think of at least one more person. GL is suddenly seized -- as if hit with 1000 volts of current. We experience it as he does -- as A VOICE INSIDE OUR HEADS. LOUD. PESTILENT. VILE. The manacles fade.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You think you can stop me? Because your jewelry can lift things? GL's hand -- his ring hand -- extends. The Ring GLOWING. With telltale spasticity, his fist jerks. The Ring SURGES and -- the APOLLO LUNAR MODULE EXPLODES! HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) They think you’re a hero? Let’s see what they think of you now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: i 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ring hand points at THE REMAINING PIPE’S MEN STUCK IN ROOM! GL’s eyes widen, realizing what Hector intends to d

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: No! Oh yes. The RING FIRES! The will of all that lives misuse in a blast that SENDS INNOC: MEN FLYING! DEAD. GL CRIES OUT. But he’s powerless to stop the mayhem. GL struggles. FOCUSING HIS RAGE. Until -- with a PRIMAL SCREAM -- GL BREAKS FREE! Regaining control of his body - and the Ring -- and -- HE SHOOTS towards Hector! A green bullet flying right at HECTOR doubles over, the exertion causing him a NEW level agony. But he raises his hand in defense, sending -- THE PIONEER 10 SATELLITE CRASHING INTO GL! Hector is literally HURLING spaceships at GL! -- the BELL XP-59 -- NORTH AMERICAN X-15 -- the MARINER PROBE -- each snapping its cables and RAINING ON GL! Who flies and dodges, fluid and nimble, using his Ring against the onslaught, as -- HECTOR presses his palms to the sides of his head -- the torment culminating, as -- His scalp starts to split and crack! Blood trickles from fresh tears in his skin. He lets out an animal GROWL as H CRANIUM DOUBLES BEFORE OUR EYES. It’s GROWING.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: DODGES Chuck Yeager’s BELL X-1, rocketing at Hector -- an GRABBING HIM -- FLYING STRAIGHT UP -- to get him the hell of there! Together, they --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRUGGLING over the D.C. sky! GL holds fast to Hector as they spiral over the monuments to freedom and democracy. Hector’s head is GROTESQUELY LARGE. Like Pipe’s mouse.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: The pain... it’s exquisite... Hector’s bloodshot eyes go wide, on fire with madness. He manifesting a new power commensurate with his transformat He focuses on GL and -- We FLASH CUT: A MEMORY HIT. From inside GL’s mind, as: Abin Sur breathes his last words to Hal.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I can see in your mind... what you remember... Your memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESUME: Hector reacts with epiphany, understanding now.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was one of you. The alien. ANOTHER MEMORY: Abin hands Hal the Ring.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: YOU. You’re the reason this happened to me. It’s all your fault! OTHER FLASHES OF MEMORY COME, like a wave of intimate det Carol’s face against the “Paris” sky... Young Carol at hi father’s wake... His family... Jim... Nathan... Carol, as before, CALLING HIS NAME from that tarmac, VOICE ECHOING

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (repeating what he hears) “Hal... Jordan.” RESUME: Green Lantern blanches. Hector knows his name. This last taunt sends GL over the edge -- his AURA EXPLOD a BURST OF ENERGY that SEPARATES the two -- SHOOTING them apart! Green Lantern ROCKETS backwards, CRASHING into --

dialogues.speaker: THE JEFFERSON MONUMENT
dialogues.text: HE BASHES into the base of Jefferson’s statue! Marble shatters! Then... Silence. No sign from GL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector drops like a meteor, about to hit the shallow pool until he FREEZES -- inches from the surface. Then rights himself. And then walks (limping) across the water. TWO TOURISTS drop their cameras and their jaws -- stunned see the giant-headed man pull a Jesus. Remarks:

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Not as hard as you’d think. He steps off the water to solid ground. A speeding car suddenly STOPS. As if it hit an invisible wall. The door opens and the DRIVER is flung from inside. Hector limps in. Hands shaking. Non-responsive. He throws the car into gear with his mind.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: ..-at the Smithsonian this evening, 39 are wounded and eight dead, including national treasure Senator Robert Hammond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark, Hal and Tom, watch the coverage of GL’s defe

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: This guy needs to go down -- now. So... how do you nail him? What’s the plan? Hal stares hard at the TV. The words, “Eight Dead.” Hal looks Tom goes.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: There is no plan. I’ve done enough.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (understanding) That wasn’t you. You didn’t hurt anybody. He killed those people --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: He used me like a bazooka! If I go after hin again... who knows what he’ll make me lo?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You can stop him --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: -- Don’t you get it? I can’t stop him. I don’t know what I’m doing. (off the Ring) They gave me this thing... but I’m not good enough to do anything with it. I’m just... a guy with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You spent your whole life screwing up and walking away from the wreckage and I stood next to you watching the whole time. But this... this isn’t school or the Air Force... or Carol... If you walk away from this... I can’t stand next to you any more.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You’re supposed to not give up! Or get help! Something! away. For the first time in his life... scared.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I bet your father was just as scared that day. But it didn’t matter, because he knew that when a chance to save people comes, you don’t think about yourself. (then) That ring can give you powers... but it can’t make you like him. Leaving Hal, alone. He looks to the TV, FOOTAGE of EIGHT BODIES carried out. He looks away -- and sees HI FATHER’S BOMBER JACKET. rumpled on a couch. The MOTTO on the shoulder patch: “FEARLESS IN FLIGHT”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Hal, finding his strength, reminded... Thanks Tom... EXT. EARTH’S ORBIT - THE STRATOSPHERE That KH-10 satellite again. It bobs silently -- before getting CUT IN HALF by a GREEN COMET shooting out of the Earth’s atmosphere. The Green Lantern is back! STAY WITH HAL -- as he picks up speed -- SLINGSHOTTING AR MARS -- AROUND JUPITER -- around a star we've never seen, until he is moving at relativity-shattering speeds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luminous planet hangs against a sea of stars. A CUT takes us over the GLEAMING SPIRES OF OA. ANOTHER CUT and we're at glorious city-level. GREEN STREAKS WHIZ BY.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: And so you return --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal trails Sinestro as they FLY over the city -- up and through the fantastical architecture.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Next time when a friend gives you warning, heed it.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I know. I screwed up. But I need your help now. How do I stop him?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: You can’t. Not alone at least.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I thought this Ring was the most powerful weapon in the Universe.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Would that it were...

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I don’t get it... What is Legion anyway? Sinestro STOPS. Landing atop the highest building. All of marvelous Oa behind him. He faces Hal. Gravely serious.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Legion is the Guardians’ shame. Sinestro extends his ring up and FIRES. IMAGES UNFURL. Beginning with: A GIANT BOOK, pages fluttering open.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are teachings in the Book of Oa the Guardians would not have us know. But moments we would prefer forgotten are still moments in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IMAGES OF HIS RING CONTINUE so we INTERCUT between th pictographic storytelling and -- FLASHBACKS to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardians float in a ring over a continental crevasse

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In their efforts to protect the Universe, the Guardians sought to harness the emanations of light. But they did not begin with Will. They began with a force far more potent... With Will’s opposite. Their cumulative concentration culminates and... A Guardi swipes the air. A THIN YELLOW FLAME -- the color of Legio appears in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fear. The Guardian passes the meager flame to his neighbor. It grows. Until the flame becomes a BLAZE, burning one of th The blaze widens, beyond their circle...

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But the light of Fear could not be controlled. Even by the Guardians. The YELLOW BLAZE rips out of orbit towards the stars. A w of toxic light spanning Creation. SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) It spread. Throughout Creation. Taking what is good and polluting it with Fear. And all things changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craggy, barren. Two LIZARD CREATURES share their scavengi as... THE YELLOW BLAZE passes over them like a tide.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In trying to bring order to the cosmos, the Guardians unleashed chaos. The lizards’ expressions turn malevolent. Distrusting the brother. They ATTACK EACH OTHER with a new ferocity. SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) The Guardians saw their mistake. And they took action. They collected this light of Fear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guardians, in a circle again. Only now FACING OUTWARD With their combined efforts the thin tendrils of Golden L return to their circle from all directions in the Univers They collect the noxious Light, into A FORM above them.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-And, once gathered, they banished it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A starless space. Blacker and bleaker than the singularit at the center of a black hole.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: To the Lost Sector. A place of containment. A place to keep safe the Guardians’ failures. The yellow torrent is cast within. It spirals inside -- a cyclone of fear and rage. It twists and writhes, coalesci No longer merely a Light. But a Life. A nascent Beast let out a wild, PRIMORDIAL HOWL. SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) But in that dark place, the Fear grew strength. And form. And shape. The swirl of fire MORPHS into a very familiar shape: Legi SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) And its rage was legion. The HOLOGRAM FADES AWAY, as we TUMBLE down through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinestro leads Hal through an UNDERGROUND EDIFICE. A catacomb of CRYSTALLINE structure, repeated matrices of G CELLS stretching on into fractal infinity.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: They made Legion?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: That is why it hunts us. To take revenge on its captors. And creators. In answer, Sinestro SWOOPS down lower into the Sciencells SINESTRO (CONT’D) With the Guardians’ permission I led a phalanx of Lanterns to scour all sectors. Even with our combined efforts, our combined will, it killed thirty-three of our number.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Finally Sinestro LANDS at his destination.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Yes. Sometimes victory comes at too high a price.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Victory?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: The Lanterns do not leave evil unbridled. Sinestro opens a CELL DOOR -- and he shows Hal why he’s brought him here. Hal’s eyes go wide with surprise -- and horror -- at the sight of -- LEGION. Captured. Trapped by CHAINS OF GREEN ENERGY. A DOZEN LANTERNS (some wounded) keep a STEADY STREAM OF RINGFIRE trained on Legion. It thrashes and brays, strain with effort to escape the pain and confinement. SHRIEKING with a rage to make the Devil piss his pants.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: You didn’t kill it?

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: The Corps does not kill. Certainly not before Legion can repay its debt of death... (approaching Legion) The Guardians have seen enough death to permit what true and final security requires. The forming of a new ring. A more powerful one.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (understanding) Of Fear. Sinestro’s eyes flash. Oh, Yes... As if understanding, Legion BELLOWS. Hal may have his doubts on how right any this is -- but that’s not why he came back here.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A piece of that is still on my planet. If the Guardians let you go after the motherload, they have to help me stop his... spawnling back home.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: I pray they will. Or soon you will have no home left. And with that dark warning, and Legion's black ROAR...

dialogues.speaker: GUARDIAN, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: We will dispatch the Corps to your planet’s aid, Hal Jordan of Gaia --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal stands before the ringed assemblage of Guardians. The loom like planets set against the night sky above.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Thank you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once you complete your cadet training on Oa. Not before. They’re refusing? Hal can’t believe what he’s hearing.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: But... I don’t understand. i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i i i

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Corps defends its own --

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- And you are not yet of the Corps.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I thought “the Corps” was supposed to protect the universe -- Earth is in the universe! We need help. And you're gonna let people die because I didn’t go through your damn boot camp?!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Some measure of suffering is universal. | There is always danger -- |

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Well this danger is killing members of my species. You guys made that thing, you : have to do something! ' The Guardians disapprove of his outburst, and respond wit thunderous SHOUT into his mind, laying down their law --

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The counterweight to suffering is the Lantern and his Ring --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- Gaia is in Sector 2814 --

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: -- If the Lantern assigned to its protection is not able --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: -- If he does not yet know how to manifest his ring’s potential -- A GUARDIAN (V.O.) j -- The fault lies with him. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: off their harsh condemnation -- and refusal -- A SHRIEK rises, loud enough to match Hal’s anger right now, as -- INT. SCIENCELLS - LEGION’S CELL - THAT MOMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sinestro approaches Legion reverentially, like an apostle FOUR OTHER LANTERNS flank him as he nears the monster. Hi Ring GLOWS, and cruelly BINDS LEGION’S LIMBS -- i  84.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Ring is the most powerful weapon in all creation. Used irresponsibly, it can produce evil greater than anything the Corps was formed to oppose. Sinestro conjures a row of SHARP PRECISION INSTRUMENTS.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is why we have imparted rules governing its use. To prevent anarchy. Sinestro uses a SCALPEL TO CUT INTO LEGION’S HIDE, Legion REELS! Straining against the green chains that bind him. They grow TAUT...

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: To prevent catastrophe. ..And SNAP! Sinestro reacts instantly, pointing -- FIRING

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Secure it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal is shaking his head, growing ever more frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: A GUARDIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you understand, Hal Jordan of Gaia?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: If your training is just gonna teach me how to let people down... I already know how to do that. Plink. Hal has just set his Ring down on the marble pilla

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Earth may be a primitive planet, but you guys, with your whole bureaucracy... you'd fit in just great there. Hal’s Uniform SHIMMERS off him, replaced by his clothes. his power gone, refused. The Guardians stare in disbelief HAL (CONT’D) Keep your Ring. I might not have the will of all that lives behind me... but I have my will to do what I can. I’11 beat this guy on my own. And Hal turns his back on the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal exits, quickly met by TWO GREEN LANTERNS, a WING-EARE WOMAN and an ivory-colored FEATURELESS MAN. They flank hi ominously, leading him towards the landing/flight platfor Wing-Ears says something in a SQUALKY ALIEN LANGUAGE.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Sorry. No ring, no speaky alien. So how do we do this? You fly me home? Or do you give me a loaner Ring -- Instead of an answer -- Wing-Ears drops suddenly. Cut dow by a YELLOW BLAST. Hal looks up to see it:

dialogues.speaker: LEGION
dialogues.text: is clawing its way out of the Sciencells! Featureless Lantern shouts at Hal in alien before... Legion’s BLAST knocks him to the ground. Hal looks up. Lanterns mobilize from all directions, FLYING. Falling into -- AN INSTANT FORMATION OF LANTERNS. Hal ducks for cover as they whip overhead, calling up wea and ATTACKING LEGION. But Legion lets loose with its hot hateful BLASTS -- the Lanterns are easily repelled. TWO MORE DIE in an instant. Hal looks down to the fallen Lanterns at his feet... kneels down to them... They might look different... but these are his brothers. PUSH IN ON HAL, as -- He takes off the fallen Lantern’s ring. And does the same thing with the others!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and metal rain down as LEGION’S CLAWS explode throu the outer wall! The monster wrenches its way out of captivity, like a demon hatching from a egg. EVERY AVAILABLE LANTERN mobilizes -- Kilowog and Tomar-Re the CADETS -- all swarming like hornets, conjuring all ma of weapons and blasts, all useless, as --

dialogues.speaker: LEGION FLIES UP
dialogues.text: In unison, the Lanterns CRISSCROSS the sky with weblike- BEAMS. Legion SWATS LANTERNS ASIDE, PULSES EXPLODING from its jaws! Lanterns fall and die, making a hole in the sky cover. Legion is about to escape through it -- when -- A SCIMITAR SLICES OFF ONE OF ITS CLAWS. SINESTRO stands in its way. His four blades swinging. Valiant, but no match for Legion. In an instant, Sinestro grabbed. Legion enjoys a moment of delight... about to ta his head off in its endless fangs when --

dialogues.speaker: A SHOCKINGLY POWERFUL RINGBLAST STRIKES LEGION
dialogues.text: The momentary distraction causes it to RELEASE Sinestro - turning its attention to its new attacker -- IT’S HAL! BACK IN UNIFORM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIELDING A POWER RING ON EACH FINGER! A master of ten Rin

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Yeah. I really need more training. Hal’s Rings conjure up an army of objects -- SAMURAI SWOR ASSORTED WEAPONRY -- anything he can think of to distract Legion from the others. He succeeds -- Legion has a taste for only his blood now... And RACES for Hal! Bait taken..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal flies fast, leading Legion away -- slaloms and twists weaving around the towers that rocket past. Legion just SMASHES through them. Pursuing relentlessly. Hal rockets HIGHER -- where SINESTRO flies to his side -- matching his speed. Hal couldn’t be happier for the help.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Glad you could make it. Together they FIRE an arsenal of GREEN WEAPONS that work elegant SEQUENCE to whittle away at Legion’s strength. We see in these two the makings of a legendary team. But Legion is only scuffed, not stopped. Sinestro and Hal barely dodge an EXPLOSIVE PULSE that takes out a BUILDING

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling) Am I allowed to kill him yet?!

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: No number of rings will be enough to slay Legion.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I wasn’t gonna use the Rings! Hal loops around a DOME. Legion SWIPES, CRACKING THE DOME WIDE OPEN -- REVEALING, inside --

dialogues.speaker: THE CENTRAL BATTERY
dialogues.text: Crackling with infinite power. He flies right for it -- FIRING AHEAD! RIGHT INTO THE BATTERY! We start to get the idea that Hal has a plan. And it’s a dumb one. He FIRES again -- right into the core -- which starts to GLOW, a nuclear bomb arming itself... Growing LOUDER and LOUDER until we feel its power surging... OVERLOADING! LIGHTNING FIRES ALL AROUND! STRIKING HAL! But he holds hi fire INTO the Battery.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Get out now! You'll die.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (straining) Just promise you’ll help my people! Sinestro nods. He will. Hal, made braver by that promise. FIRES ONE LAST TIME -- INTO THE BATTERY -- which PULSES - and ROILS -- until... it... finally gives out --

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODING WITH POWER
dialogues.text: A GREEN DETONATION like the Big Bang itself, traveling... STRAIGHT THROUGH HAL. Coursing through his body! It’s too much! Hal holds it together just long enough to bring his hands together -- channelling all that endless energy to --

dialogues.speaker: FIRE WITH EVERYTHING HE HAS AT LEGION
dialogues.text: A RINGLBLAST THE LIKES OF WHICH GOD HAS NEVER SEEN! The combined power of all life expended at once. So much ener the RINGS ON HIS HAND DISINTEGRATE! It is finally enough. Legion is stricken. And dies. The Lanterns who have come to witness the unthinkable fea watch as Legion drops. The nightmare ended. The Corps’ surprise only outdone by their shock when they see --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: still hanging in the sky... ile plummets. Lifelessly. He POUNDS into the ground at then foot of the CRACKED and SP battery. Sinestro and Tomar-Re are the first to reach him. The smo starts to clear, REVEALING... Hal. Unmoving. He is a hero today. And he is dead. At least, that’s what we think. Until... Hal shudders and coughs. Life returning. Beaten up... but still Hal.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (weak; @ la post-dogfight) Well... that was easy. Sinestro helps him to his feet. Hal’s temples are now GRE (Fanboys orgasm appropriately.)

dialogues.speaker: TOMAR-RE
dialogues.text: You should be dead.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Don’t sound so disappointed. Sinestro turns to ALL THE LANTERNS who have assembled.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: Hal Jordan of Gaia came here seeking our help and saved us instead. (then) Today we show him how the Corps defends its own. For he has proven he is one of us. If his planet needs help... it will find us ready. It will see a storm! The Lanterns CHEER! Raising their Rings in unison!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC BUILDS as SINESTRO, TOMAR-RE and KILLOWOG and a HUN OTHER LANTERNS rocket towards us, led by... GREEN LANTERN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol and Carl linger over the news reports of Senator Hammond's death played on several plasma screens --

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (ON PLASMA)
dialogues.text: ...Senator Robert H. Hammond, astronaut and American hero is dead at 72... Carl runs a hand over the Sabre floor model.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: He was our last shot at getting these off the ground. We could’ve saved lives...

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We'll get the funding, Dad. Venture capital maybe. But Carl knows better. His dream... it’s over.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: No. It’s time for me to get on with my life. And for you to finally have one. A hug that says he understands the sacrifices she’s made. Appreciative, holding her father, Carol is distracted by something in the distance: TOM slinking down to the shelt

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I thought Hangar 18 was closed?

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: The old fallout shelter? It is. Why? Carol’s not sure either. Curiosity piqued, she beelines t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol is standing at the head of the metal staircase she spied Tom descending. She moves down it, through an old metal door, and into:  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom faces his bank of monitors/displays, so he doesn’t se CAROL push through the metal doors and down the stairs. S takes in the space and -- with an audible GASP -- Abin’s alien ship. Tom turns. Sees her. Shits.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Tom... Anything you’d like to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl moves through his workspace, flicking off the lights by one. He lingers over a Sabre model. Saying goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: Sorry, Martin. Let you down again. A moment of regret. And Carl is suddenly SUCKED out of th showroom -- CRASHING THROUGH a glass partition -- into -- The hangar. He hangs in mid-air, floating above one of th SABRE PROTOTYPES, terrified by the sight of... A GARGANTUAN HEAD. It lists to one side, neck no longer a to support it fully. We PAN DOWN over the cracked and mottled scalp to recognize -- HECTOR. His body useless. He drools slightly. His hands tremble, curled into claws around the arm of a WHEELCHAIR pushed by haggard and disheveled BROOME, a hellish orderl

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I’m looking for a Mr. Hal Jordan. You know where I can find him? Carl stares back, bloody and scared.

dialogues.speaker: CARL FERRIS
dialogues.text: What are you -- ? Hector sighs, as if he’s being put out.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Not here? Hector looks over to Sabre. An idea flashes.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. How about we bring him to us? His brow furrows and... the engine FOOMS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom tap dances his way out of Carol’s question:

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s a... prototype I’m working on, a cross-model design sorta thing, took some fuselages and... probably won’t even fly, I thought of it when I was stoned --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Do you honestly think I can’t recognize a SPACESHIP when I see one?!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (flinching) It’s not my fault -- just don’t hit me -- Before Carol can press, the room is ROCKED by a THUNDERCL from outside. Carol BOLTS out, Tom trailing, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE ENTIRE FLEET OF SABRES pulls out of the hangar and TAKES OFF, soaring into the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: We didn’t have a test flight scheduled for tonight, did we?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No! Carol and Tom race across the pavement back to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol runs in -- Tom behind her -- but the sight of her father, writhing in mid-air, freezes them in their tracks

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Dad--! Her gasp snares Hector’s attention. A MEMORY HIT: Carol’s face from Hal’s minds eye. Hector grins, “recognizing” he

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
