dialogues.text: I know you. Focusing on Carol, Hector’s brow furrows, using his new power. ANOTHER MEMORY: Carol in “Paris,” almost kissing G HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Hal Jordan. (re: his “condition”) This is his fault. It’s because of him I’m this... monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of Sabres shoot over the coastline, BANKING toward homes and buildings.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So now I’m going to destroy every thing and everyone he’s ever loved... ...The U-CAVs align for a STRAFING RUN, birthing MISSILES SPITTING BULLETS! Architecture disintegrates. HECTOR HAMMOND (V.O.) (CONT’D) Starting with this crappy city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector is eye to eye with Carol now.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: ..-and ending with you. While he watches. (off Carol’s terror) That okay by you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the Santa Monica Pier of yesteryear. Boardwalk, Ferr Wheel, a world of taffy. Full of oblivious INNOCENTS. Hel Jordan laughs as Nathan pleads with his father:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (re: the Ferris Wheel) Just one more time.

dialogues.speaker: JIM JORDAN
dialogues.text: You already had five ‘one more’ times.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Those didn’t count. Pleeeeeze? Who’s saying no to that kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous beach views, stuffed with traffic in front of a TUNNEL (like PCH). Drivers HONK as -- BOOOOM! -- a wild FIREBALL EXPLODES out of the tunnel! FOUR SABRES FLY OUT of the fire, spinning to take aim at bridge. Cars EXPLODE and TUMBLE as the Overpass COLLAPSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Sabre DEPLOYS. The quaint city center is no more! Coast City is being destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON HECTOR: Eyes rolling with the remote controlling the U-CAVs. Face exultant with the death he brings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Ferris Wheel zenith. Jim’s bored out of his mind a Nathan presses his face to the gondola window, entranced.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad? (pointing) What're those? Jim glances up to see two SABRES bearing down on them! No time to panic or answer as -- the Sabres split, DIVING towards the base of the ride -- GUNS BLAZING -- The wheelhouse CRUMPLES! Metal cries in protest and... The entire structure starts to topple! Like a redwood fel and falling, casting its vast SHADOW on the ground... ove HELEN! Feet rooted by fear. NATHAN lets out a SHRIEK -- Jim pulls Nathan close as the fall -- it’s over -- Until the ENTIRE WHEEL is suddenly awash in GREEN LIGHT. Nathan and Jim open their eyes to see... A RHINO-SHAPED LANTERN. KILLOWOG. A FORCEFIELD from his Ring holding the wheel then setting it upright.

dialogues.speaker: KILLOWOG
dialogues.text: (to Nathan; a greeting) Poozer.

dialogues.speaker: OHMYGODTHATISSOCOOOOOOL
dialogues.text: At which, the sky goes DARK. A SHADOW passes over Nathan' face, as he looks up to see... A SKY FULL OF GREEN LANTERNS! A storm to blot out the sun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HECTOR: Delighted. With a sick glance to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: He’s here. And he’s brought friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LANTERNS split off like fireworks, streaks of emerald blazing in all directions to address Hector’s mayhem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killowog ring-welds the Ferris Wheel’s base secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Sabres DECIMATES the rollercoaster’s TRACK. Th ‘coaster FLIES off the rails, about to CRUSH terrified bystanders before... being caught by a HUGE GREEN CLAW. Manifested by TOMAR-RE’S Ring. The Sabre comes around for another try... buzzing the boardwalk. The crowd FLEES, a TIDAL WAVE of people, but.. SINESTRO stands his ground, awaiting the Sabre’s approach like a gunfighter. THE OTHER LANTERNS crisscross over the city. One stops a LANDSLIDE with a GIANT GREEN SHOVEL. Another rescues a family from a collapsing building. A SCHOOL BUS is set ri after teetering over an overpass. The PEOPLE’S appreciation overwhelms their fear of the strange creatures saving them...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE BOARDWALK
dialogues.text: Sinestro and Hal, side by side, manifest the weapons that dispatched Legion, Scimitar and Samurai sword, and SLICE through the horde of U-CAVs flying right at them! Through the SMOKE they see two last Sabres coming at them Sinestro prepares, poising his scimitars.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: The threat to your planet... surely it isn’t only these machines.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: It’s not these... it’s who sent them. (realizing) Carol --

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO
dialogues.text: We have this. Go! With Sinestro to handle the Sabres, and the team of Lante to help those in need, Hal BARRELS at FULL SPEED to -- FE AIRCRAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A human-sized bullet hole RIPS open as GL bursts through. searches. No sign of Carol. But -- TOM and CARL are held captive, lifted high above, a WHIRL of TOOLS and HEAVY EQUIPMENT SWIRLING around them dangero close. All by HECTOR... who’s slavering for the fight. A monster in a chair, his vile head housing his murderous m

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: You‘re late. I almost had to kill everyone without you. Hector tries to penetrate Hal’s mind with his own -- to CONTROL HIM -- but Hal’s aura shines brighter than ever.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Let them go.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Sure. With a raised brow... Carl and Tom go flying out the hang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT GREEN HAND catches Carl and Tom. Places them safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, Hector FIRES the maelstrom of metal at GL -- who conjures a SHIELD to deflect it (A PIECE KNOCKS BROOME ba and unconscious). Hector’s chair wheels toward GL confidently. He makes a rag rise to wipe his sticky chin.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Nice. But not enough to save her... Your Carol. (knowingly) I could see you all over her mind... years of disappointment. Only to disappoint her now. One last time. Hal turns to Hector, rage in his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every memory she had of you is filled with regret... the years wasted, waiting for you. You never did a thing for her until someone gave you that ring. (eyes lighting up at the RING) You don’t deserve all that power. Without that ring, you’re not a hero. You're barely even a man.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (through his teeth) Where. Is. She?

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Relax. She’s right here. Hector glances over to that first Sabre prototype. GL’s e go wide when he sees... Carol. In the translucent PAYLOAD the U-CAV. Trapped. Pounding on the soundproofed plexi. Hector relishes the obvious pain on GL’s face. HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) Now from what I’ve seen of your childhood, you don’t have such a good history with plane crashes. Hector’s eyes close. The Sabre’s engines FIRE. NEARBY: The guidance computer LOCKS on a DESTINATION. A MOUNTAIN RANGE! The trajectory of Carol’s death plotted. t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT’D) All that power and you can’t do a thing. You're paralyzed. Get it? (laughing, the point of it all) Now you know what it’s like to be me. The Sabre’s engines ready for take-off. GL steals a look back at Carol. Their eyes lock. Sympathy. Regret. GL can’t let her down. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: But you don’t know what it’s like to be me. You want power? Real power? Just let her go. And I’1l give you this. He shows HIS RING. We fear for the choice he is making.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This Ring can give you more power than you knew existed. Its only limit is what you can hold in your mind. And your mind is a lot bigger than mine. Hector’s eyes light up at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With this you can do anything. Be anything. You can kill me as many times as you want. You can rule the world. (a final bargain) All you have to do is let her go. Hector considers the shiny offer. The WHINE of the Sabre’ engines MOUNTS. And finally -- SLOWING. It’s a deal.

dialogues.speaker: HECTOR HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Fine. Take her... In response, GL... removes his Ring. He opens his palm an the Ring FLOATS UPWARD. Pulled towards Hector by his mind As the ring leaves Hal, GL’s uniform dissolves. And... FOOM! THE SABRE TAKES OFF! With Carol still trapped insid (And before she could see GL’s true face.) HECTOR HAMMOND (CONT'‘D) Sorry. I lied. The ring flies to Hector’s hand. And the second it does - Carol BLASTS into the sky. Off to her death. Hector EXPLODES the GUIDANCE COMPUTER with his mind. Fear fills Hal’s face as he watches his love recede into the s he turns to see -- HECTOR -- as he --

dialogues.speaker: PUTS ON THE RING
dialogues.text: The Ring GLOWS instantly with the connection. ENERGY BEAM all around. The LUCENT AURA LIGHTS AROUND HIM and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He RISES from his wheelchair, the aura giving him the strength his body lacks... Hector’s eyes grow wide with rapture. His face ecstatic.. He knows now what true power is. A flick of his wrist and he makes the WALL EXPLODE with G LIGHTNING. Another and CRAGGLY CLAWED FINGERS (his versio of the Green Hand) RIP THE GROUND OPEN underfoot. SOMETHING GROWS out of the Ring. RIPPING THROUGH THE GROU

dialogues.speaker: -- UP HIGHER
dialogues.text: CONSTRUCT -- Hector has the exultant look of a man just named messiah. As Hector’s mountainous creation grows... its spires begi CHANGE, MORPHING into TENTACLES. The entire construct’s shape momentarily takes on the full form of

dialogues.speaker: LEGION
dialogues.text: IT FLARES! Twisting and writhing. The Ring’s power is too much for Hector. There’s A FLASH OF WORRY on HECTOR’S FAC as the energy becomes TOO MUCH FOR HIM. Hal grins.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I lied, too. You weren’t chosen. Hector gets it now. He doesn’t possess the will to contro the Ring -- until finally -- The ENERGY SURGES BACK DOWN! Hector WAILS as all that ene FIRES BACK AT HIM.

dialogues.speaker: AN EXPLOSION OF LIGHT AND HEAT
dialogues.text: And it’s all gone. Mangled, mutated Hector has fallen bac into his chair, twitching, cataplectic. And so he’ll stay Of its own accord THE RING zips off Hector’s finger and.. Flies right back into Hal’s hand. CLOCK! Broome gives Hector a WALLOP, straight to the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: BROOME
dialogues.text: That’s for making me rob a bank, asshole! Broome looks up to thank his savior... but Hal is already BOLTING OUT -- chasing after Carol in the Sabre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running, Hal fits on the Ring. He extends his hand, ready fly -- BUT THE RING ONLY PULSES. IT HAS NO CHARGE LEFT. The Ring can’t help him anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: The Lantern!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks. His underground lair is a half mile off! And th Sabre is getting further away by the second... closer to

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN RANGE
dialogues.text: Hal looks around -- his eyes landing on something... and fills him with courage:

dialogues.speaker: AN F-16
dialogues.text: waiting on the tarmac! Without a second’s hesitation, HAL POUNDS FOR IT. TOM approaches, catching up --

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Use your ring!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: There isn’t enough time to charge it! She’s heading for the Maker Cliffs. It’s gonna crash!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (as he climbs in the jet) Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: How?!

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: I got the ride to figure that out. But he doesn’t need a ring. Just aman. Still a hero. As the canopy SLAMS SHUT -- EXT. SKY / INT. HAL’S F-16 - INTERCUT Carol’s flying prison sweeps into view, a runaway train. struggle muffled. She sees the CLIFFS coming up ahead -- fear doubles. She BASHES helplessly against the glass, as

dialogues.speaker: HAL'S F-16
dialogues.text: swoops down in pursuit. He’s caught up to the Sabre -- ju a few feet behind Carol now. Hal swerves his F-16 ahead -

dialogues.speaker: TRYING TO CATCH IT IN HIS SLIPSTREAM AND FORCING A TURN -
dialogues.text: but the Sabre presses on relentlessly, making its straigh line for

dialogues.speaker: THE MAKER CLIFFS
dialogues.text: From back in the TOWER -- TOM comes on the HEADSET:

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (FROM HEADSET)
dialogues.text: Can you see her?

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (INTO HEADSET)
dialogues.text: I can’t move it. Shut it down!

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (FROM HEADSET)
dialogues.text: The system’s blown! It won’t respond. Hal tries again, BARRELLING over the U-CAV dangerously cl trying to PHYSICALLY PUSH IT DOWN. But the Sabre is able maneuver out of every move Hal can think of. And the CLIF are DEAD AHEAD! How the hell is he going to stop that thi

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (FROM HEADSET)
dialogues.text: There’s nothing you can do.

dialogues.speaker: HAL, (INTO HEADSET)
dialogues.text: I can’t let her die! Hal fights panic. Ghosts of old deaths haunting him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m pushing her to the runway. I can do it! ON HAL. Inspired by his father’s memory. There's still on thing left. He races his plane in front of the Sabre --

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Tom... What do you guess the blowback on an ejector is?!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: A hundred feet easy at the speed you’re flying! PULLS a switch that ARMS A WARNING LIGHT. Tom reacts to w he sees on his display. Hal's “plan.” TOM (INTO HEADSET) (CONT’D) Hal? Nonono. You can’t do it! You’ll hit the jet, you'll both die! And without a single thought for himself, Hal YANKS a RED LEVER. Hard. In an instant --

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN JORDAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m clear. Ejecting now -- I’m clear. Ejecting now --

dialogues.speaker: PLANE AND INTO THE SKY. HE JUST HIT THE EJECTOR SEAT
dialogues.text: In an instant Hal’s PARACHUTE deploys and entangles onto SABRE. He SLAMS PAINFULLY AGAINST THE SIDE OF THE SABRE. CONTACT! Like he just jumped from one train car to anothe only at 10,000 feet and nearing the sound barrier! Hal pulls against the crushing WINDSHEAR up the ‘chute -- closer... His fingers SNAG the wing of the U-CAV. With impossible effort, he PULLS himself up to the nose. CAROL is POUNDING on the payload from the inside now. SCREAMING. And then she sees him. HAL JORDAN. What the fuck is he doing on her plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal sees the CLIFFS AHEAD -- they are SECONDS away from impact. He reaches for a PANEL on the top of the fuselage Digs in and... RIPS it open -- exposing a BUTTON. Which h PUNCHES! THE PAYLOAD CANOPY goes FLYING! Hal reaches in a pulls Carol up. Wind rips into them.

dialogues.speaker: SAVING YOU
dialogues.text: He grabs her, FALLING BACKWARDS! And -- THEY FALL. Above them the Sabre speeds off ahead -- and --

dialogues.speaker: EXPLODES INTO THE CLIFFS
dialogues.text: They may have been saved from that -- but they’re in FREE FALL. No Ring. No chute. Just Hal and Carol clutching eac other as they achieve bone pulverizing terminal velocity. Tumbling in each other’s arms... The air ROARING... The GROUND COMING UP FAST... Death is seconds away. They hold each other tight. The wind to painful too speak But they don’t have to -- they both know it. They have lo each other their whole lives. They love each other still. Nothing left to do, they clutch each other even harder an They kiss. A lifetime's worth of love shared in the one moment left before their deaths. The tenderest goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: SINESTRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All life is connected. By love, by hope, by all the noblest instincts of the soul. If ever a kiss embodied those noblest instincts... it is one. All that passion unbridled... SINESTRO (V.O.) (CONT’D) The power drawn from that connection is what you see simply as “green.” The Ring feels it first. It SHIMMERS -- DRAWING FROM ALL POWER IN THAT KISS! The radiance spreads. Up his arm. Brightening... the AURA REKINDLING, enveloping them BOTH. his clothes recrystallizing back into... the uniform of:

dialogues.speaker: THE GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Recharged! Hal/GL and Carol are so lost in their embrace. their kiss so long awaited... they don’t even notice THEY'VE STOPPED FALLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal/GL realizes. He looks to his Ring, which SHIMMERS. Carol opens her eyes. And looks. Exhilaration replacing terror as she sees it -- she’s being carried by the GREEN LANTERN. BY HAL. The pieces fall together. Life changes.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (hits him) I_knew it was you!

dialogues.speaker: HAL/GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. He smiles, taking soft hold of Carol, and... FLYING acros the sky... HAL/GREEN LANTERN (0.S.) (CONT’D) How ‘bout we land in Paris? The blue sky MATCH DISSOLVES into the blue curtain of:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PRESIDENT is at the podium, addressing a standing-roo only crowd of MEDIA:

dialogues.speaker: THE PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: My fellow Americans. The past days have seen events so miraculous, they shatter every conception we have about ourselves... our world... our place in Creation. We can look on these wonders with fear... or we can find hope. A new beginning. To provide answers and to quell anxieties, I’d like to turn this briefing over to Special Counsel to the President... Mr. Alan Scott. A weathered older man steps to the podium. A familiar fac And, now, a NAME.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE / ALAN SCOTT
dialogues.text: The President has given me the honor and solemn responsibility of making this announcement, one I suspect will be long remembered. (a beat, then) We are not alone in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LANTERNS use their Rings to repair the widespread dam PEOPLE marvel at the sight of ALIENS on Earth. Tomar-Re bristles his top fin, slightly offended.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE / ALAN SCOTT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For years now, we’ve known of a group of extraterrestrials who patrol our universe and keep it safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we realize that we’ve caught up with our OPENING.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT, (ON ASTROVISION)
dialogues.text: Impossible to imagine? No more impossible than when Columbus suggested the earth was round or when Copernicus posited that it orbited the sun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. OTHER CITIES ALL OVER THE WORLD
dialogues.text: People stare at the impossible news projected there as we

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There are heroes out there. And now, one of our own has joined them. One of us. Now one of them. CLOSE ON: GREEN LANTERN. ALAN SCOTT (V.O.) (CONT’D) A Green Lantern. Widen to REVEAL we're:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green Lantern walks with Scott down a long concrete hallw

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: Nice speech.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT
dialogues.text: I’ve known about the people you work for since I was... younger than you. Ever since, I’ve worked for the goverment. Helping them get ready for a day just like this... when this planet finds out it’s just a tiny pebble on a very large beach. (beat) And people need to know it’1l be okay when you’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: I haven’t said I was going anywhere. Scott nods. Eyeing the Ring with a bit of... nostalgia?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT
dialogues.text: The Ring came to you, so that’s your decision to make. But I’1l tell you this: If I could do what you can do... I wouldn’t stay here. I’d fly around this Universe, seeing things no human's ever seen... No one who wears one of those belongs to any one planet. You belong to the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (sensing, re: The Ring) You've... worn it, haven’t you? A long silence. Then, through the haze of smoke and memor

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT
dialogues.text: One like it, a lifetime ago... (a sad smile) But it wasn’t mine to keep. I wasn’t chosen. Not like you. A story for another day/movie. The gruff returns.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: What if there’s more trouble?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT
dialogues.text: I'll contact you. The same way I used to contact your predecessor on occasion. A knowing wink. Man, this guy is cool as shit.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: And Hammond?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT
dialogues.text: Hammond? I wouldn’t worry about him... Pipe keys a pad to take them where they’re headed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a catwalk, overlooking the centerpiece of the facility STADIUM-SIZED CONCRETE-LINED LAB. Filled with -- ROW AFTER ROW of RATS and MICE in cages. As we saw before Experiments. At the far end --

dialogues.speaker: IN A SEALED CELL
dialogues.text: HECTOR HAMMOND sits. Huge cranium, burned and shrivelled body. Utterly grotesque. No sign of life behind his eyes. Just another rat.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SCOTT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He doesn’t do much anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH GL AND PIPE
dialogues.text: Pipe offers GL his hand. And his advice: ALAN SCOTT (CONT’D) The stars are waiting, Jordan. Don’t screw it up. GL reacts. Scott knows his identity.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: It’s not fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal, in uniform, stands with Carol and Tom. This is goodb Floating a few thousand feet up are Sinestro, Tomar-Re an OTHER LANTERNS. Tom stares a little too much.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You get to go off with them and I’m stuck here. I can’t even play games with aliens now, just seems like a rip off.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: I got a surprise for you. GL FIRES his ring... into HANGAR 18. A RUMBLE and... ABIN SHIP RISES OUT! The ship HOVERS on its own. Fixed. The single greatest thing that ever happened to Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It's flying! I have a space ship! That flies! Oh my god, I can visit you -- Tom hugs GL hard enough to hurt. Then makes way for... Carol. Time for her goodbye. Not an easy thing.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN LANTERN
dialogues.text: (to Tom) Can I get a minute. Tom moves to his hovering craft by the hangar. The Lanter in the sky fly off even higher. Into the upper atmosphere GL de-uniforms, suit shimmering back into clothes. Just H

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Give my family a good excuse why I left --

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: (missing her already) I could be gone awhile.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I’ll be here. Besides, you're worth the wait.

dialogues.speaker: HAL
dialogues.text: So are you. And her lips meet his in a kiss that shows an understandi words can’t. His Ring SHIMMERS with it. The SHIMMERING BRIGHTENS, MERGING INTO... PURE SUNLIGHT...
